Umineko Project (UP): After we chased them out, ......nobody said another word.
Steam (ST): After we chased them out, ...nobody wanted to say anything.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After we chased them out, ......nobody wanted to say anything.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちは、彼らを追放してから、……もう誰も、ただの一言も発しなくなった。
Russian (RU): После того как мы прогнали их...... никто не проронил ни слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois que nós os expulsamos, ......ninguém disse mais nenhuma palavra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把他們趕出房間後，……誰都沒再說過一句話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把他们赶出房间后，……谁都没再说过一句话。
Italian (IT): Dopo averli allontanati via... nessuno di noi proferì parola...
Turkish (TR): Biz onları attıktan sonra, ......kimse tek kelime etmedi.

Umineko Project (UP): ...We had exiled all of the suspicious ones. Even though we had known that there might be some innocents among them, we had exiled them all the same.
Steam (ST): ...All of the suspicious ones had been driven away. Even though we knew there might be some innocents among them, we still did it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...All of the suspicious ones had been chased out. Even though we had known that there might be some innocents among them, we had chased them out.
PC Japanese (JP): …疑わしきを全て追放した。その中に潔白な人間がいるかもしれないことを知りながら、追放した。
Russian (RU): ...Все, на кого пало подозрение, были изгнаны. Даже несмотря на то, что среди них могли находиться невиновные, мы всё равно выгнали их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Nós já exilamos todos os suspeitos. Mesmo sabendo que poderia haver algum inocente entre eles, nós exilamos todos da mesma forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …我們把所有疑惑都趕走了。明知道其中可能有無辜的人，還是全部趕了出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …我们把所有疑惑都赶走了。明知道其中可能有无辜的人，还是全部赶了出去。
Italian (IT): Tutti i sospettati erano stati allontanati. Li avevamo cacciati, sebbene sapessimo che tra loro potevano esserci degli innocenti...
Turkish (TR): ...Tüm şüphelileri sürgün etmiştik. Aralarında masumların da olabileceğini bildiğimiz halde hepsini sürgün etmiştik.

Umineko Project (UP): ......We had chased them out of this paradise, where people didn't have to doubt each other.
Steam (ST): ...We chased them out of this paradise... where people don't have to suspect each other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......We had chased them out of this paradise where people didn't have to doubt each other.
PC Japanese (JP): ……互いを疑い合わなくてよい楽園から、彼らを追放した。
Russian (RU): ......Мы изгнали их из рая, в котором не нужно подозревать друг друга.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Nós tínhamos posto eles para fora deste paraíso, onde as pessoas não precisavam duvidar uma das outras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……從這個無須互相猜疑的樂園，把他們排除了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……从这个无须互相猜疑的乐园，把他们排除了。
Italian (IT): Li avevamo cacciati via dal paradiso, dove noi non avevamo motivo di sospettarci a vicenda.
Turkish (TR): ......Biz onları, insanların birbirlerinden şüphelenmek zorunda kalmadıkları bu cennetten kovmuştuk.

Umineko Project (UP): However, our motive for chasing them out had been suspicion of our fellow man—the worst kind of crime for a human.
Steam (ST): But our motive for chasing them out was suspicion of one person towards another, the worst kind of crime for a human.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But our motive for chasing them out had been suspicion of others, the worst kind of crime for a human.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、彼らの追放の動機は人が人を疑うという、人として最低の罪によるもの。
Russian (RU): Но мотивом для изгнания было подозрение других — худшее преступление для человека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, nosso motivo para expulsá‐los foi por suspeitarmos de nossos próprios companheiros — o pior tipo de crime para um ser humano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，趕走他們的動機是“懷疑”，這是身為人類，最低劣的罪惡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，赶走他们的动机是“怀疑”，这是身为人类，最低劣的罪恶。
Italian (IT): Ma a motivare la loro espulsione era stato il peggior peccato possibile: dubitare del prossimo...
Turkish (TR): Ancak onları kovma sebebimiz, bir insan için en kötü suç türü olan—kendi dostlarımızdan şüphelenmekti.

Umineko Project (UP): ......If we had been able to accept the existence of a 19th person, of the witch, ......then we all might still be talking face to face, trusting in each other.
Steam (ST): ...If we had accepted the existence of a 19th person, of the witch, ...then we all might still be talking face to face, trusting in each other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......If we had accepted the existence of a 19th person, of the witch, ......then we all might still be talking face to face, trusting in each other.
PC Japanese (JP): ……もし、１９人目の存在として、魔女の存在を受け容れられたなら、……自分たちは今も、互いを信じあってこの部屋で膝を寄せ合えたのではないだろうか。
Russian (RU): ......Если бы мы приняли существование 19‐го человека‐ведьмы...... то сейчас могли бы разговаривать, глядя в лицо и доверяя друг другу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se nós formos capazes de aceitar a existência de uma 19ª pessoa, da bruxa, ......então nós talvez ainda possamos continuar a conversar frente a frente, confiando uns nos outros.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……如果，能把魔女當成第十九人，接受她的存在的話，……我們是否就能互相信任，在這房間裡共享安寧了呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……如果，能把魔女当成第十九人，接受她的存在的话，……我们是否就能互相信任，在这房间里共享安宁了呢？
Italian (IT): Se avessimo accettato l'esistenza di una 19ª persona, l'esistenza della strega... avremmo potuto fidarci l'un l'altro, e conversare tra di noi in questa stanza, faccia a faccia.
Turkish (TR): ......Eğer 19. bir kişinin, yani cadının varlığını kabul edebilseydik, ......o zaman hepimiz hala yüz yüze konuşuyor ve birbirimize güveniyor olabilirdik.

Umineko Project (UP): In that instant, we had agreed to chase out all of the suspicious people.
Steam (ST): In that instant, we had agreed to chase out all of the suspicious people.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that instant, we had agreed to chase out all of the suspicious people.
PC Japanese (JP): あの瞬間。疑わしきを全て追放することに、自分たちは賛成した。
Russian (RU): Однако в тот момент мы согласились выгнать всех подозрительных людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele instante, nós concordamos em expulsar todos aqueles que eram suspeitos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那一瞬間。我們都贊成了，直接排除所有的疑惑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那一瞬间。我们都赞成了，直接排除所有的疑惑。
Italian (IT): In quel momento, decidemmo di allontanare tutte le persone sospette...
Turkish (TR): Bir anda, tüm şüpheli insanları atmaya karar vermiştik.

Umineko Project (UP): ......But had that been the right thing to do?
Steam (ST): ...But had that been the right thing to do?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、それが正しかったのかどうか。
Russian (RU): ......Но был ли этот поступок правильным?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas isso tinha sido mesmo a coisa certa a se fazer?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……可是，這究竟是對是錯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……可是，这究竟是对是错。
Italian (IT): Ma... era stata la cosa corretta da fare?
Turkish (TR): ......Ama bu yapılacak doğru şey miydi?

Umineko Project (UP): ......During this endless silence, we could do nothing but be quietly tormented by that sin......
Steam (ST): ...During this endless silence, we could do nothing but be quietly tormented by that sin...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......During this endless silence, we could do nothing but be quietly tormented by that sin...
PC Japanese (JP): ……いくら過ごせども尽きぬ沈黙の時間は、ただただ静かにその罪を苛み続ける……。
Russian (RU): ......В этой бесконечной тишине мы могли только тихо мучиться осознанием совершённого греха......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Durante esse silêncio interminável, não podíamos fazer nada além de sermos silenciosamente atormentados por esse pecado......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……漫無邊際的沉默，靜靜責問著這份罪孽……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……漫无边际的沉默，静静责问着这份罪孽……。
Italian (IT): Durante quel silenzio che non sembrava aver mai fine, quel peccato non faceva altro che tormentarci...
Turkish (TR): ......Bu bitmeyen sessizlik boyunca, o günahın sessiz azabını çekmekten başka bir şey yapamadık......

Umineko Project (UP): Aunt Natsuhi was facing the door, seated all the way back in her sofa, not letting go of her rifle for even an instant.
Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi faced the door, without letting go of her rifle for even an instant, sitting far back in the sofa.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san faced the door, without letting go of her rifle for even an instant, sitting far back in the sofa.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんはライフル銃を片時も手放さず、扉を正面にしながら、ソファーに深く腰をかけていた。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи сидела на диване лицом к двери, ни на секунду не опуская ружья.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Natsuhi, que estava em frente à porta, sentou de volta no sofá, sem largar seu rifle por nenhum instante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃伯母依然一刻也沒有放開來福槍，面對著門，重重癱坐在沙發上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃伯母依然一刻也没有放开来复枪，面对着门，重重瘫坐在沙发上。
Italian (IT): Zia Natsuhi si era sprofondata sul divano, rivolta verso la porta senza mai lasciare andare il suo fucile, nemmeno per un istante...
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze koltuğunda arkasına yaslanmış, tüfeğini bir an bile elinden bırakmadan kapıya doğru bakıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......She would probably spend the night staring at the door without a wink of sleep.
Steam (ST): ...She would probably spend the night staring at the door without a wink of sleep.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……多分、今夜は一睡もせず扉を見張り続けるだろう。
Russian (RU): ......Она, скорее всего, проведёт всю ночь глядя на дверь и не смыкая глаз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela provavelmente iria passar a noite encarando a porta sem sequer dormir por um segundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大概，她會一夜不眠地監視著門吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大概，她会一夜不眠地监视着门吧。
Italian (IT): Probabilmente, sarebbe stata capace di fissare la porta senza chiudere occhio per tutta la notte.
Turkish (TR): ......Belki de geceyi gözünü bile kırpmadan kapıya bakarak geçirecekti.

Umineko Project (UP): George‐aniki was gazing through a gap in the closed curtains by the window, looking down at the courtyard and the mansion that surrounded it.
Steam (ST): George-aniki gazed through a gap in the closed curtains by the window, looking down at the courtyard and the mansion that surrounded it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George-aniki gazed through a gap in the closed curtains by the window, looking down at the courtyard and the mansion that surrounded it.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治の兄貴は、カーテンを閉じた窓の隙間から、中庭と、それを囲む屋敷を眺めている。
Russian (RU): Джордж‐аники пристально смотрел в окно через проём в занавесках, разглядывая внутренний двор и окружавший его особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O George‐aniki estava olhando através da janela, por uma fresta nas cortinas fechadas, olhando para o pátio e a mansão que o rodeava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治大哥站在窗前，從緊閉的窗簾縫隙眺望著里院，以及四周的大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治大哥站在窗前，从紧闭的窗帘缝隙眺望着里院，以及四周的大屋。
Italian (IT): Attraverso uno spiraglio tra le tende chiuse della finestra, il fratellone George stava scrutando la villa, e il cortile che la circondava...
Turkish (TR): George-aniki pencerenin yanındaki kapalı perdelerin aralığından, avluya ve onu çevreleyen malikaneye bakıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Whether he was checking to see if any suspicious shadows would become visible through the window, ...or whether he was engaged in some deep internal conversation, ...I couldn't tell.
Steam (ST): ...I didn't know whether he was checking to see if a suspicious shadow would become visible through the window... or whether he was wondering to himself about something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I didn't know whether he was checking to see if a suspicious shadow would become visible through the window, ...or whether he was wondering to himself about something.
PC Japanese (JP): ……不審者の影が窓に映らないか確認しているのか、…何かに対し自問自答しているのか、…わからない。
Russian (RU): ......Выжидал ли он, если вдруг за окном появится подозрительная тень... или о чём‐то размышлял... я не знаю.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se ele estava checando para ver se não havia nenhuma sombra suspeita visível através da janela, ...ou se estava envolvido em alguma conversa interior profunda, ...eu não saberia dizer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……他是在檢查窗戶有沒有映出可疑人物的影子嗎？…還是在對著什麼自問自答？…不清楚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……他是在检查窗户有没有映出可疑人物的影子吗？…还是在对着什么自问自答？…不清楚。
Italian (IT): Non sapevo se stesse controllando se qualche ombra sospetta si sarebbe riflessa sulla finestra... o se stesse riflettendo tra sé e sé.
Turkish (TR): ......Pencereden şüpheli bir gölgenin görünüp görünmeyeceğini mi kontrol ediyordu, ...yoksa kendi içinde derin düşüncelere mi dalmıştı, ...bilemiyordum.

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica was sitting at an angle on the sofa next to Aunt Natsuhi's...with a dead expression on her face.
Steam (ST): Jessica was sitting sideways on the sofa next to Aunt Natsuhi...with a dead expression on her face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica was sitting sideways on the sofa next to Natsuhi oba-san, ...with a dead expression on her face.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香は、夏妃伯母さんの脇のソファーに斜めに腰掛け、…死んだような表情を浮かべていた。
Russian (RU): Джессика с безжизненным выражением лица сидела на диване рядом с тётей Нацухи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica estava em um assento numa posição diagonal e próxima à tia Natsuhi...com uma expressão sem vida em seu rosto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香斜靠在夏妃伯母旁邊的沙發上，…一臉生無可戀的表情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香斜靠在夏妃伯母旁边的沙发上，…一脸生无可恋的表情。
Italian (IT): Jessica si era seduta sul divano con una postura inclinata, accanto a zia Natsuhi... con un'espressione in volto priva di vita...
Turkish (TR): Jessica, Natsuhi Teyze'nin yanındaki kanepede belli bir açıyla...yüzündeki ölü ifadeyle oturuyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......And every once in a while, as though she'd just remembered something, she would take out the inhaler that she had used during her asthma attack and stick it in her mouth.
Steam (ST): ...And every once in a while, as though she'd just remembered something, she'd take out the inhaler she had used during her asthma attack and stick it in her mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、時折思い出したように、あの喘息の発作の時に使っていた吸入器を取り出し、くわえていた。
Russian (RU): ......И время от времени, словно вспоминая о чём‐то, она вытаскивала свой ингалятор, который использовала во время приступов астмы, и засовывала его в рот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E de vez em quando, como se ela se lembrasse de algo, pegava o inalador que ela usava quando tinha ataques de asma e o colocava na boca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……時而像是回想起了什麼，取出哮喘發作時用過的吸入器，放進嘴裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……时而像是回想起了什么，取出哮喘发作时用过的吸入器，放进嘴里。
Italian (IT): E come ogni tanto si ricordava di fare, tirava fuori l'inalatore che usava per i suoi attacchi d'asma, per poi tenerselo in bocca...
Turkish (TR): ......Ve arada bir, sanki bir şey hatırlamış gibi, astım krizi sırasında kullandığı astım spreyini çıkarıp ağzına götürüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...I just heard it from Aniki, but, ......apparently Jessica liked Kanon‐kun.
Steam (ST): ...I just heard it from Aniki, ...but apparently Jessica liked Kanon-kun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...I just heard it from Aniki, but,......apparently Jessica liked Kanon-kun.
PC Japanese (JP): …さっき兄貴に教えられたが、……朱志香は嘉音くんのことが好きだったらしい。
Russian (RU): ...Я недавно услышал это от Аники, но...... вероятно, Джессике нравился Канон‐кун.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eu ouvi isso do aniki, mas, ......aparentemente, a Jessica gostava do Kanon‐kun.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …剛才大哥告訴我，……朱志香似乎喜歡嘉音君。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …刚才大哥告诉我，……朱志香似乎喜欢嘉音君。
Italian (IT): Il fratellone me l'aveva detto poco prima, ma... apparentemente a Jessica piaceva Kanon-kun.
Turkish (TR): ...Az önce Aniki'den duydum ama, ......sanırım Jessica Kanon-kun'dan hoşlanıyormuş.

Umineko Project (UP): It seems that it was such a vague thing that she hadn't realized it herself.
Steam (ST): It was apparently so vague that she hadn't realized it herself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seems that it was such a vague thing that she hadn't realized it herself.
PC Japanese (JP): それは本人もまだ自覚に至っていない淡いものらしかった。
Russian (RU): Однако не похоже, чтобы она успела толком понять что‐то сама.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que havia sido algo tão vago que ela nem havia percebido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這份淡淡的戀情，好像連她本人都還未察覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这份淡淡的恋情，好像连她本人都还未察觉。
Italian (IT): Sembrava fosse una sensazione così vaga, da non esserne lei stessa consapevole...
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre bu o kadar belirsiz bir şeydi ki kendisi bile fark etmemişti.

Umineko Project (UP): ...You know. It's the kind of thing that other people tend to spot before the person in question realizes it.
Steam (ST): ...You know. It's the kind of thing other people tend to spot before the person in question realizes it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …ほらあれだ。周りで見ている人たちの方が、本人よりも先に察してしまうというやつだ。
Russian (RU): ...Вы наверняка встречались с подобным. Это одна из тех вещей, которую другие люди, наблюдающие со стороны, замечают раньше, чем её замечает и осознаёт человек, о котором идёт речь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Você sabe. É o tipo de coisa que outras pessoas acabam notando antes mesmo que a pessoa em questão se dê conta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …就是那種吧。周圍旁觀的人，比本人還要先察覺到的那種。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …就是那种吧。周围旁观的人，比本人还要先察觉到的那种。
Italian (IT): Sapete a cosa mi riferisco. Sono quel genere di cose che le persone attorno a noi tendono a notare prima della persona in questione...
Turkish (TR): ...Bilirsiniz işte. Bu, söz konusu kişi fark etmeden önce diğer insanların fark edebileceği türden bir şey.

Umineko Project (UP): ...In that case, ......she might have first learned of her feelings when the person she liked died.
Steam (ST): ...Which means... she might've first learned of her feelings when the person she liked died.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …だとしたら、……想い人の死で初めて、自分の想いに気付いたのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ...В таком случае...... она, возможно, впервые осознала свои чувства, когда человек, которого она любила, умер.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Nesse caso, ......ela pode ter percebido seus próprios sentimentos quando a pessoa que ela gostava morreu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …果真如此的話，……那麼她說不定是由心愛之人的死，才第一次察覺到了自己的心意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …果真如此的话，……那么她说不定是由心爱之人的死，才第一次察觉到了自己的心意。
Italian (IT): Se così fosse... forse si era resa conto dei suoi sentimenti solo dopo la morte del suo amato...
Turkish (TR): ...Bu durumda, ......hissettiklerini daha ilk kez sevdiği kişi öldüğünde fark etmiş olabilir.

Umineko Project (UP): .........It was truly pitiful and sad.
Steam (ST): ......It must've been so terrible, so sad.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………それは、とても気の毒で悲しいことに違いなかった。
Russian (RU): .........Это действительно грустно и печально.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........É realmente lamentável e triste.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………這無疑是一件，無比可怜而又無比悲哀的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………这无疑是一件，无比可怜而又无比悲哀的事。
Italian (IT): Sicuramente era in uno stato davvero miserabile e deplorevole.
Turkish (TR): .........Gerçekten acınası ve üzücüydü.

Umineko Project (UP): Come to think of it, ...Kanon‐kun had been the one to hand her that inhaler. ......Maybe she was remembering that.
Steam (ST): Come to think of it, ...Kanon-kun was the one who handed her that inhaler. ...Maybe she was remembering that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Come to think of it, ...Kanon-kun had been the one to hand her that inhaler. ......Maybe she was remembering that.
PC Japanese (JP): そういえば、…あの吸入器は嘉音くんが差し出してた。……それを思い出しているのだろうか。
Russian (RU): Если подумать, Канон‐кун был тем, кто дал ей этот ингалятор. ......Может быть, она вспоминала об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pensando nisso, ...o Kanon‐kun foi quem entregou aquele inalador para ela. ......Talvez ela estivesse se lembrando daquilo.

Umineko Project (UP): As for me, ......I was fishing around Grandfather's study, thinking I'd research the meaning of the magic circle on the second sheet of the letter.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was fishing around Grandfather's study, ...thinking I'd research the meaning of the magic circle on the second sheet of the letter.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quanto a mim, ......eu estava tentando encontrar algo entre os muitos livros do vovô, pensando que eu deveria investigar o significado do círculo mágico na segunda folha da carta.

Umineko Project (UP): Even though we were shut up here in a defensive position, my rebellious nature made me want to keep up the offense, find some key to all of this.
Steam (ST): Even though we were shut up here in a defensive position, my rebellious nature made me want to find some key, some way to resist.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though we were shut up here in a defensive position, my rebellious nature made me want to find some key, some way to resist.
PC Japanese (JP): ここに閉じ篭るという守勢に回りながらも、何かの鍵を見つけたいという攻勢を維持したい俺の反抗心だった。
Russian (RU): Даже несмотря на то, что мы были заперты здесь, заняв оборону, из‐за своего бунтарского характера мне захотелось найти какой‐нибудь ключ или способ дать отпор.

Umineko Project (UP): That was some pretty strong language at the end there...{n}She realized very well that these were only words, but even so, she was strongly resolved to protect her daughter even if she had to become a demon.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "......So......this letter was a trap...?! How'd they put it here?! There wasn't anyone in this room except for us eight!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「……じゃあ、……この手紙は罠だってのかよ…？！　どうやってここに置いたんだよ？！　この部屋には私たち８人以外には誰もいなかったんだぜ？！」
Russian (RU): "......Так значит...... это письмо было ловушкой?! Как преступник положил его сюда?! Кроме нас восьми в этой комнате никого не было, так ведь?!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……那，……这封信难道是圈套吗…？！怎么才能把信摆在这里呀？！这房间除了我们八个人以外没有别人啊？！」
Italian (IT): "...Quindi... questa lettera era una trappola...?! Come ha fatto a metterla qui?!{n}A parte noi otto non c'era nessuno nella stanza, o sbaglio?!"
Turkish (TR): "......Yani......bu mektup bir tuzak mıydı...?! Buraya nasıl koydular?! Bu odada sekizimizden başka kimse yoktu!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "A‐anyway, let's ignore how they got it in here for now. ......The culprit was after just one thing! They wanted to spread the seeds of doubt inside this impregnable study and use us to throw the sacrificial sheep out...!!"
Steam (ST): "A-Anyway, let's ignore how they got it in here for now. ...The culprit was after just one thing! They wanted to spread the seeds of doubt inside this impregnable room and use us to throw the sacrificial sheep out...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "A, anyway, let's ignore how they got it in here for now. ......The culprit was after just one thing! They wanted to spread the seeds of doubt inside this impregnable room and use us to throw the sacrificial sheep out...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「と、とにかく、どうやってここに置いたのか、その方法は捨て置くぜ。……とにかく、犯人の狙いはたったひとつ！　この鉄壁の書斎に疑心暗鬼を引き起こして、生贄羊を俺たちの手で外へ放り出させることだったんだ…！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「と、とにかく、どうやってここに置いたのか、その方法は捨て置くぜ。……とにかく、犯人の狙いはたったひとつ！　この鉄壁の書斎に疑心暗鬼を引き起こして、生贄の羊を俺たちの手で外へ放り出させることだったんだ…！！」
Russian (RU): "К‐как бы там ни было, давайте пока что проигнорируем это. ......Преступник стремился добиться лишь одного! Они хотели посеять сомнение внутри этой непроницаемой комнаты, чтобы мы собственными руками отдали часть людей на заклание!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "D‐De qualquer forma, vamos ignorar isso por agora. ......O culpado estava atrás de uma única coisa! Ele queria semear as sementes da dúvida dentro desse estúdio inexpugnável e nos usar para oferecermos as ovelhas como sacrifício...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「總、總之，先不管是怎麼放在這裡的。……總之，犯人的目的只有一個！讓固若金湯的書房中的人陷入疑神疑鬼的狀態，好讓我們自己把活祭的羔羊推出門外…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「总、总之，先不管是怎么放在这里的。……总之，犯人的目的只有一个！让固若金汤的书房中的人陷入疑神疑鬼的状态，好让我们自己把活祭的羔羊推出门外…！！」
Italian (IT): "C-Comunque sia, lasciamo perdere per ora come sia riuscito a metterla...{n}Ad ogni modo, il colpevole aveva un solo obiettivo! Voleva spargere il seme del dubbio all'interno di questo studio impenetrabile, facendo sì che cacciassimo gli agnelli sacrificali con le nostre mani...!!"
Turkish (TR): "N-Neyse, şimdilik buraya nasıl soktuklarını görmezden gelelim. ......Suçlu tek bir şeyin peşindeydi! Bu dokunulmaz çalışma odasının içine şüphe tohumları serperek kurbanları dışarı atmamız için bizi kullanmak istediler...!!"

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't surprising that Aunt Natsuhi remained unpleasantly silent.{n}...Even if this was all a trap by the culprit, even if the four who had been chased out of the room were in danger, it had nothing to do with the safety of the four people in here.
Steam (ST): It wasn't surprising that Aunt Natsuhi remained unpleasantly silent. ...Even if this was all a trap by the culprit, even if the four who had been chased out of the room were in danger, it had nothing to do with the safety of the four people in here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It wasn't surprising that Natsuhi oba-san remained unpleasantly silent....Even this was all a trap by the culprit, even if the four who had been chased out of the room were in danger, it had nothing to do with the safety of the four people in here.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんが苦々しく沈黙するのは当然だ。…仮に全てが犯人の罠で、さっき部屋から追放した４人が危ないとしても、今ここにいる４人の安全とは関係がない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃伯母さんが苦々しく沈黙するのは当然だ。{n}…仮に全てが犯人の罠で、さっき部屋から追放した４人が危ないとしても、今ここにいる４人の安全とは関係がない。
Russian (RU): Было не удивительно, что тётя Нацухи продолжала пребывать в неприятном молчании.{n}...Даже если письмо оказалось ловушкой, даже если те четверо, изгнанные из комнаты, находились в опасности, всё это не имело никакого отношения к безопасности находившихся в этой комнате четверых людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era surpreendente que a tia Natsuhi permanecesse naquele silêncio desagradável.{n}...Mesmo se tudo isso tiver sido uma armadilha do culpado, mesmo se os quatro que foram postos para foram estiverem em perigo, isso não tinha nada a ver com a segurança das quatro pessoas que estavam aqui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃伯母會苦苦保持沉默也是理所當然的。{n}…就算這全是犯人的圈套，剛才從房間中趕出去的那四人身處險境，也和現在房間裡四人的安全完全無關。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃伯母会苦苦保持沉默也是理所当然的。{n}…就算这全是犯人的圈套，刚才从房间中赶出去的那四人身处险境，也和现在房间里四人的安全完全无关。
Italian (IT): Era naturale che zia Natsuhi mantenesse un silenzio poco rassicurante...{n}Anche se tutto questo era una trappola del colpevole, e i quattro cacciati via erano in pericolo, non aveva niente a che vedere con l'incolumità delle quattro persone lì presenti.
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze'nin hoş olmayan bir sessizlik içinde kalması şaşırtıcı değildi.{n}...Tüm bunlar suçlunun bir tuzağı olsa bile, odadan atılan dört kişi tehlikede olsa bile, bunun buradaki dört kişinin güvenliğiyle hiçbir ilgisi yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): And there was no way to prove the innocence of the four people we had kicked out.{n}......If we're willing to let them die, then we shouldn't leave this room no matter what. ...That way is...safest!!
Steam (ST): And there was no way to prove the innocence of the four people we'd chased out. ...If we're willing to let them die, then we shouldn't leave this room no matter what. ...That way is...safest!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And there was no way to prove the innocence of the four people we had chased out.......If we're willing to let them die, then we shouldn't leave this room no matter what. ...That way is...safest!!
PC Japanese (JP): しかも追放した４人の潔白を証明する方法はない。……彼らを見殺しにする覚悟があるのなら、何があろうともこの部屋を出るべきではないのだ。…それが、一番安全！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかも追放した４人の潔白を証明する方法はない。{n}……彼らを見殺しにする覚悟があるのなら、何があろうともこの部屋を出るべきではないのだ。…それが、一番安全！！
Russian (RU): Вдобавок не было никакого способа, чтобы доказать невиновность четверых выставленных людей.{n}......Если мы готовы дать им умереть, то нам ни за что не следует покидать эту комнату. ...Так будет... безопаснее всего!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E também não havia como provar a inocência das quatro pessoas que foram colocadas para fora.{n}......Se nós estamos dispostos a deixá‐los morrer, então nós não devemos deixar esse quarto, não importa o que aconteça. ...Essa é a forma mais...segura!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，被趕出去的四人的清白，根本無從證明。{n}……既然有對他們見死不救的覺悟，那麼無論如何都不該從這房間出去。…這麼做，是最安全的！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，被赶出去的四人的清白，根本无从证明。{n}……既然有对他们见死不救的觉悟，那么无论如何都不该从这房间出去。…这么做，是最安全的！！
Italian (IT): E non c'era modo di provare l'innocenza delle quattro persone espulse...{n}Se era pronta a lasciare che morissero, allora non avrebbe assolutamente dovuto lasciare la stanza... Era la cosa più sicura da fare!!
Turkish (TR): Ve dışarı attığımız dört kişinin masumiyetini kanıtlamanın da hiçbir yolu yoktu.{n}......Eğer onların ölmesine izin vereceksek, ne olursa olsun bu odadan çıkmamalıyız. ...Bu yol...en güvenlisi!!

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……こんな話をしていてすぐに鳴ったのだ。{n}その電話が、追い出された彼らからのＳＯＳの電話に違いないと思うのは当然のことだった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Começou a tocar bem no momento em que começamos essa conversa.{n}Era natural pensarmos que fosse um pedido de socorro dos outros que haviam sido colocados para fora.

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "Le‐let's take it, Auntie...! The phones might have been fixed for some reason... It could still be an urgent call from Maria‐chan and the rest...!"
Steam (ST): "L-Let's pick it up, Aunt Natsuhi...! The phones might've been fixed for some reason... It could still be an urgent call from Maria-chan and the rest...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "L, let's take it, Oba-san...! The phones might have been fixed for some reason... It could still be an urgent call from Maria-chan and the rest...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「と、取ろう、伯母さん…！　何かの理由で電話が回復したのかも…。真里亞ちゃんたちからの緊急の電話の可能性もある…！」
Russian (RU): "Н‐надо ответить, тётя!.. Вдруг связь по какой‐то причине наладилась... Ещё может быть, что это срочный звонок от Марии‐чан и остальных!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "V‐Vamos atender, tia...! Os telefones podem ter voltado a funcionar por algum motivo... Pode ser que seja uma chamada urgente da Maria‐chan e dos outros...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「接、接吧，舅母…！或許是因為什麼電話又能用了…。有可能是小真里亞他們打來的緊急電話啊…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「接、接吧，舅母…！或许是因为什么电话又能用了…。有可能是小真里亚他们打来的紧急电话啊…！」
Italian (IT): "R-Rispondiamo, zia...! I telefoni potrebbero essere ripartiti per qualche ragione... Potrebbe essere una chiamata urgente da Maria-chan e dagli altri...!"
Turkish (TR): "Ha-Hadi açalım Teyze...! Telefonlar bir nedenden dolayı düzelmiş olabilir... Maria-chan ve diğerlerinden gelen acil bir arama olabilir...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right...! And on the slight chance that it is a call from the killer, bring it on! Let 'em friggin' talk...! It's just a phone call. No matter what they babble through the receiver, it's not like it's gonna hurt you...!!"
Steam (ST): "That's right...! And if it actually is a call from the culprit, bring it on! Why don't we listen to what they've got to say...?! It's just a phone call. No matter what they babble through the receiver, it's not like it's gonna hurt you...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right...! And on the slight chance that it is a call from the culprit, bring it on! Why don't we listen to them...! It's just a phone call. No matter what they babble through the receiver, it's not like it's gonna hurt you...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだぜ…！　それに万一、犯人からの電話だったら上等さ！　話を聞いてやろうじゃねぇか…！　それにどうせ電話だ。受話器越しに何をほざいたって痛くも痒くもないぜ…！！」
Russian (RU): "Согласна!.. А если вдруг, ввиду ничтожной вероятности, нам звонит преступник, так отлично! Устроим ему беседу! Это всего лишь телефонный звонок. Чего бы он нам не наговорил по трубке, особого вреда нам уж точно не будет!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo...! E com uma pequena chance de ser um telefonema do assassino, pode vir! Deixa ele falar...! É só um telefonema. Não importa quem estiver do outro lado, isso não vai machucar você...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊…！而且萬一，是犯人打來的電話的話也正好！就聽聽他怎麼說…！反正只是電話。隔著話筒無論他怎麼說都是不痛不癢嘞…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊…！而且万一，是犯人打来的电话的话也正好！就听听他怎么说…！反正只是电话。隔着话筒无论他怎么说都是不痛不痒嘞…！！」
Italian (IT): "Giusto...! E se, nel peggiore dei casi, fosse una chiamata del colpevole, allora tanto meglio! Sentiamo cos'ha da dire...! È solo una telefonata. Può dire quello che gli pare attraverso la cornetta, ci scivolerà tutto addosso...!!"
Turkish (TR): "Bu doğru...! Ve küçük bir ihtimal de olsa katil arıyor olabilir! Neden ne söyleyeceklerini dinlemiyoruz...?! Bu sadece bir telefon görüşmesi. Ahizeden ne saçmalarlarsa saçmalasınlar bize zarar verebilecek değiller ya...?!"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 少なくとも、電話を掛けてきたのは真里亞じゃない。{n}真里亞は受話器から離れたところで何か歌を歌っているからだ。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............And yet, they weren't saying anything. ...Why...? For what reason... ............The person who made this phone call...who was it......?!?!
PC Japanese (JP): …………なのに、何もしゃべってくれない。…なぜ…。どうして…。…………この電話を掛けてきたのは、誰なんだッ……？！？！

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Ainda assim, não estavam falando nada. ...Por quê...? Por qual motivo... ............Quem foi a pessoa que fez essa ligação......?!?!

Umineko Project (UP): "I don't know...! All I can say is, ...this is probably a trap, ......and Maria's in trouble..."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): Aunt Natsuhi took the receiver again, but after calling into it several more times, she realized that she wasn't getting anywhere and hung up.
Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi took the receiver again, but after yelling into it several more times, she realized that she wasn't getting anywhere and hung up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san took the receiver again, but after yelling into it several more times, she realized that she wasn't getting anywhere and hung up.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんは再び受話器を取り、何度呼びかけても埒が明かないとわかると、電話を一度切った。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи снова взяла трубку, но несколько раз крикнув в неё, она поняла, что ничего не добьётся, и повесила её.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そうか、電話が回復したなら警察にだって通報できるはず。{n}……しかし、伯母さんの反応を見る限り、外線電話は相変わらずつながらないようだった。
Russian (RU): Всё верно, ведь работай телефоны, мы могли бы дозвониться до полиции.{n}......Но судя по тётиной реакции, с внешней телефонной линией соединиться не удавалось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ah, certo, se os telefones voltaram, nós devemos conseguir entrar em contato com a polícia.{n}......Mas julgando pela reação dela, a linha externa ainda não havia sido reconectada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對了，電話能用了的話應該就可以報警。{n}……可是，一看伯母的反應，就知道外線電話似乎仍然不通。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对了，电话能用了的话应该就可以报警。{n}……可是，一看伯母的反应，就知道外线电话似乎仍然不通。
Italian (IT): Già, se i telefoni avessero ripreso a funzionare, avremmo potuto contattare la polizia... Ma a giudicare dalla sua reazione, la linea esterna era ancora scollegata.
Turkish (TR): Oh doğru, eğer telefonlar düzeldiyse polise ulaşabilmeliyiz.{n}......Ama tepkisine bakılırsa dış hat hâlâ kesikti.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊啊，说的对！！朱志香和夏妃伯母就留在这里吧！」

Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah, it might be better that way. ...If the goal of that phone call was to split us up further, it wouldn't be a good idea to leave someone to watch this room."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだな、その方がいいかもしれねぇぜ。…電話が、俺たちをさらに分散させる狙いがあるってんなら、留守番を残すのは適当じゃねぇ」
Russian (RU): "Да, может, так даже лучше. ...Если звонок был сделан с целью разделить нас, то оставить кого‐нибудь сторожить эту комнату будет не самой разумной затеей."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是找了个像是拿来举行诡异仪式的三叉烛台，当做武器。
Italian (IT): Presi un candelabro a tre bracci, che probabilmente serviva per qualche bizzarro rituale, e lo presi come mia arma.
Turkish (TR): Garip bir ritüel için kullanılabilecek gibi görünen üç uçlu bir şamdan buldum ve kendimi onunla silahlandırdım.

Umineko Project (UP): With the spikes it had to fit the candles on, although they were short, it was almost like a three‐pronged spear.
Steam (ST): Although the pins on it used to fit candles were short, it was almost like a three-pronged spear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Although the pins on it, which were used to fit candles, were short, it was almost like a three-pronged spear.
PC Japanese (JP): 蝋燭を挿すトゲが短いながらもついているそれは、さながら三叉の槍のようだった。
Russian (RU): Хотя его шипы для фиксации свечей были короткими, он почти походил на трезубец.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com as pontas para encaixar as velas, apesar de curtas, parecia quase uma lança de três pontas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 插蠟燭的刺雖短但都完好無損，宛如一把三叉戟。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 插蜡烛的刺虽短但都完好无损，宛如一把三叉戟。
Italian (IT): Aveva degli spuntoni per poter infilare le candele, sebbene fossero corti, per cui era quasi come una lancia a tre punte.
Turkish (TR): Kısa olmalarına rağmen mumları sığdırmak için kullanılan sivri uçlarıyla neredeyse üç uçlu bir mızrak gibiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): Then the four of us left the study. We left the study, which should have been the safest place inside the mansion.
Steam (ST): Then, the four of us left the study. We left the study, which should've been the safest place inside the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then the four of us left the study. We left the study, which should have been the safest place inside the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): そして俺たちは書斎を出る。この屋敷の中で、一番安全な場所だったはずの書斎を、出る。
Russian (RU): Наша четвёрка покинула кабинет. Мы вышли из кабинета, которому полагалось быть самым безопасным местом во всём особняке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então nós quatro deixamos o estúdio. Nós deixamos o estúdio, que deveria ser o lugar mais seguro dentro da mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後我們走出了書房。走出了這個大屋中，理應是最安全的地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后我们走出了书房。走出了这个大屋中，理应是最安全的地方。
Italian (IT): E così noi quattro lasciammo lo studio. Uscimmo da quella stanza, che sarebbe stata il posto più sicuro all'interno della villa.
Turkish (TR): Sonra dördümüz birden çalışma odasından ayrıldık. Malikânenin içindeki en güvenli yer olması gereken çalışma odasını terk ettik.

Umineko Project (UP): And so we had been lured out, despite the fact that we had barricaded ourselves in a safe locked room, ...and perhaps, we were even......repeating exactly the same series of events that had led to Grandfather disappearing from there...
Steam (ST): By doing this, we had been lured out, even though we had barricaded ourselves in a safe closed room. ...Perhaps, we were... ...doing exactly the same thing Grandfather had done when he disappeared from that room...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By doing this, we had been lured out, even though we had barricaded ourselves in a safe closed room. ...Perhaps, we were..., ......doing exactly the same thing that Grandfather had done when he had disappeared from that room...
PC Japanese (JP): こうして俺たちは、安全な密室に篭城したにもかかわらず誘き出され、…ひょっとするとそれは…、……祖父さまがこの部屋から失踪した時のことを、再びなぞり直すことになってしまう…。
Russian (RU): Сделав это, мы позволили выманить себя, хотя до этого пребывали в безопасной запертой комнате...... возможно, мы сами...... поступили точно так же, как и дедушка, когда он исчез из своей комнаты...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E nós havíamos sidos atraídos para fora, apesar de todas as barricadas que tínhamos feito para criar um quarto fechado seguro, ...e possivelmente, nós estávamos repetindo......a mesma série de eventos que levaram o vovô a desaparecer dele...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就這樣，我們儘管曾經在安全的密室中籠城堅守，卻還是被引誘了出來，…或許…，……這就是爺爺從房間失踪過程的，完美再現…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就这样，我们尽管曾经在安全的密室中笼城坚守，却还是被引诱了出来，…或许…，……这就是爷爷从房间失踪过程的，完美再现…。
Italian (IT): Facendo questo, eravamo stati attirati fuori, nonostante ci fossimo barricati in una camera chiusa sicura... Probabilmente... stavamo ripetendo le stesse azioni che fece il nonno, quando scomparve dalla sua stanza...
Turkish (TR): Böylece kendimizi güvenli ve kilitli bir odaya kapatmış olmamıza rağmen dışarı çekilmiştik, ...ve hatta belki de......Büyükbabamın oradan kaybolmasına neden olan olaylar dizisinin aynısını tekrarlıyorduk...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Mariaaa!! Where are youuu?! Answer meee!!"
Steam (ST): "Maria!! Where are you?! Answer me!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Maria-!! Where are you-?! Answer me-!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「真里亞ー！！　どこにいるんだよー？！　返事をしろー！！」
Russian (RU): "Мария‐я‐я! Где‐е‐е ты?! Отзови‐и‐сь!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mariaaa!! Onde você está?!!! Me responda!!"
Italian (IT): "Mariaaa!! Dove seiiii?! Rispondimiii!!"
Turkish (TR): "Mariaaa!! Neredesiiin?! Cevap veer!!"

Umineko Project (UP): I listened closely, but didn't hear anything...{n}The mansion was vast, and the sound of the rain even noisier than before, as if the passing typhoon was making its last stand.
Steam (ST): I listened closely, but didn't hear anything... The mansion was vast, and since the passing typhoon was making its last stand, the sound of the rain was even noisier than before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I listened closely, but didn't hear anything... The mansion was vast, and since the passing typhoon was making its last stand, the sound of the rain was even noisier than before.
PC Japanese (JP): 耳を澄ますが、何も聞こえない…。屋敷は狭くないし、過ぎ去ろうとしている台風は最後の足掻きとばかりに、雨音を一層騒がせる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 耳を澄ますが、何も聞こえない…。{n}屋敷は狭くないし、過ぎ去ろうとしている台風は最後の足掻きとばかりに、雨音を一層騒がせる。
Russian (RU): Я прислушался, но ничего не услышал...{n}Особняк был обширным, и поскольку напоследок ураган решил выложиться по полной, звуки дождя стали ещё громче, чем раньше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu escutei atentamente, mas não consegui ouvir nada...{n}A mansão era vasta, e o som da chuva era ainda mais barulhento do que antes, como se o tufão estivesse dando seu último suspiro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然已經在仔細傾聽，但什麼都聽不到…。{n}大屋十分寬敞，即將離去的台風正做著最後掙扎，使雨聲更加吵鬧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然已经在仔细倾听，但什么都听不到…。{n}大屋十分宽敞，即将离去的台风正做着最后挣扎，使雨声更加吵闹。
Italian (IT): Drizzai le orecchie, ma non sentii niente... La villa non era angusta, e siccome il tifone di passaggio stava facendo i suoi ultimi scroscii, il suono della pioggia era più frastornante che mai.
Turkish (TR): Dikkatle dinledim ama hiçbir şey duymadım...{n}Malikane kocamandı ve yağmurun sesi eskisinden daha da gürültülüydü, sanki geçmekte olan tayfun da son çırpınışlarını yapıyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "...Maria‐chan said that she wanted to watch TV in the parlor, right?! Let's try going downstairs!"
Steam (ST): "...Maria-chan said she wanted to watch TV in the parlor, right?! Let's try going downstairs!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Maria-chan said that she wanted to watch TV in the parlor, right?! Let's try going downstairs!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…真里亞ちゃんは確か、客間でテレビを見たいと言ってたよね？！　階下に下りてみよう！」
Russian (RU): "...Мария‐чан сказала, что хочет посмотреть телевизор в гостиной, так?! Давайте попробуем спуститься вниз!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...A Maria‐chan disse que queria ver TV na sala de visitas, certo?! Vamos procurar lá embaixo!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…小真里亞好像說過，想去客廳看電視吧？！去樓下看看！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…小真里亚好像说过，想去客厅看电视吧？！去楼下看看！」
Italian (IT): "...Maria-chan aveva detto che voleva vedere la TV in salotto, giusto?! Scendiamo al piano di sotto!"
Turkish (TR): "...Maria-chan salonda televizyon izlemek istediğini söylemişti, değil mi?! Aşağı inmeyi deneyelim!"

Steam (ST): "......That's right. Let's try there. ...Everyone, be mindful of your surroundings!"

Russian (RU): "............Согласна. Хорошая мысль. ......Ребята, будьте начеку и смотрите в оба!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Sim. Vamos ir ver. ......Pessoal, fiquem atentos ao seu redor!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………是呢。去看看吧。……大家小心周圍！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………是呢。去看看吧。……大家小心周围！」
Italian (IT): "...Giusto. Proviamo ad andare lì... Guardatevi intorno!"
Turkish (TR): "............Evet. İyi fikir. ......Herkes etrafına dikkat etsin!"

Umineko Project (UP): With Aunt Natsuhi in the center, her rifle readied and her finger on the trigger, we moved in a group, our backs together, checking our surroundings in all directions......
Steam (ST): With Aunt Natsuhi in the center, her rifle readied and her finger on the trigger, we moved in a group, our backs together, checking our surroundings in all directions...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With Natsuhi oba-san in the center, her rifle readied and her finger on the trigger, we moved in a group, our backs together, checking our surroundings in all directions......
PC Japanese (JP): ライフル銃を構え、引き金に指を掛ける夏妃伯母さんを中心に、俺たちは背中を寄せ合うようにしながら、周囲を警戒しつつ一塊になって移動する……。
Russian (RU): С тётей Нацухи в центре, державшей ружьё наготове, а палец на спусковом крючке, мы двигались группой, спина к спине, озираясь во всех направлениях......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com a tia Natsuhi no centro, seu rifle estava apontado e com o dedo no gatilho, nós nos movemos em grupo, de costas um para o outro, checando o que estava ao nosso redor em todas as direções......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃伯母在中央，舉著來福槍，把手指放在扳機上，我們則背靠著背圍成一團，一邊小心防範著四周一邊移動著……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃伯母在中央，举着来复枪，把手指放在扳机上，我们则背靠着背围成一团，一边小心防范着四周一边移动着……。
Italian (IT): Con zia Natsuhi al centro, che aveva il fucile in posizione, e il dito poggiato sul grilletto, ci spostammo in gruppo, schiena contro schiena, controllando con vigilanza in tutte le direzioni...
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze ortada, tüfeği hazır ve parmağı tetikte, Grup halinde, sırt sırta vermiş, çevremizi her yönden kontrol ederek ilerliyorduk......

Umineko Project (UP): As though the power of that magic circle designed to spread discord had brought it all into being, ...we had split up, and furthermore, had been dragged into dangerous territory.
Steam (ST): It was just as though the magic of that magic circle designed to spread discord had worked. ...We had split up, and furthermore, had been dragged out into dangerous territory.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was just as though the magic of that magic circle designed to spread discord had worked. ...We had split up, and furthermore, had thrown them out into dangerous territory.
PC Japanese (JP): さっきの不和を目論むという魔法陣が、まるでその魔力で成したように。…俺たちは分裂し、しかもその上、危険地帯へ引きずり出されている。
Russian (RU): Казалось, будто магия того волшебного круга, призванного посеять раздор, начала работать. ...Мы оказались разделены и, кроме того, отправились на опасную территорию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele círculo mágico tinha por objetivo semear a discórdia, esse era seu poder. ...Nós tínhamos nos separado, e, além disso, estávamos sendo levados ao território do inimigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛才以不和為目的的魔法陣，簡直就像以魔力完成了它的使命似的。…不僅使我們內部分裂，還把剩下的人也拉進了危險地帶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚才以不和为目的的魔法阵，简直就像以魔力完成了它的使命似的。…不仅使我们内部分裂，还把剩下的人也拉进了危险地带。
Italian (IT): Era come se il potere di quel cerchio magico, creato per causare discordia, avesse funzionato... Ci eravamo divisi, ed inoltre, ci aveva trascinato in un territorio pericoloso...
Turkish (TR): Sanki aramızda anlaşmazlık yaratmak için tasarlanmış o büyülü çemberin gücü her şeyi meydana getirmiş gibi, ...ayrılmıştık ve dahası tehlikeli bir bölgeye sürüklenmiştik.

Umineko Project (UP): ......In other words, even now in this very moment, we were doing just what the culprit wanted us to do. ...This was now a strange space where it wouldn't be odd for anything to suddenly occur...
Steam (ST): ...In other words, even now, we were doing just what the culprit wanted us to do. ...This was a separate world where it wouldn't be odd for anything to suddenly occur...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In other words, even now, we were doing just what the culprit wanted us to do. ...This was a separate world where it wouldn't be odd for anything to suddenly occur...
PC Japanese (JP): ……ということはつまり、今この瞬間、犯人のシナリオに乗っかっているということになる。…ここからは突然何が起きてもおかしくない異空間なのだ…。
Russian (RU): ......Другими словами, даже сейчас мы делали то, чего преступник от нас добивался. ...Это был отдельный мир, где вполне неожиданно может случиться что угодно...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em outras palavras, nesse exato momento, estávamos fazendo exatamente o que o culpado queria que fizéssemos. ...Estávamos agora em um espaço estranho, onde não seria esquisito se algo acontecesse de repente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……也就是說，這個瞬間，我們正被犯人的計劃牽著鼻子走。…我們身處於一個，突然發生什麼都不奇怪的異樣空間…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……也就是说，这个瞬间，我们正被犯人的计划牵着鼻子走。…我们身处于一个，突然发生什么都不奇怪的异样空间…。
Italian (IT): In altre parole, in quel momento stavamo seguendo il copione stilato dal colpevole... Eravamo in una dimensione a noi aliena, dove non sarebbe stato strano se fosse avvenuto qualcosa all'improvviso...
Turkish (TR): ......Başka bir deyişle, şu anda bile tam da suçlunun yapmamızı istediği şeyi yapıyorduk. ...Burası artık herhangi bir şeyin aniden ortaya çıkmasının garip olmayacağı tuhaf bir alandı...

Umineko Project (UP): Aunt Natsuhi nervously pointed the barrel of the gun at every dark spot and shadow.
Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi nervously pointed the barrel of the gun at every dark spot and shadow.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san nervously pointed the barrel of the gun at every dark spot and shadow.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんは物陰や暗がりがある度に神経質に銃口を向ける。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи нервно направляла ствол ружья на каждое тёмное пятно или тень.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Natsuhi, nervosa, apontou sua arma para cada canto escuro e sombra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃伯母每當發現陰影或暗處，就會神經質地把槍口指過去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃伯母每当发现阴影或暗处，就会神经质地把枪口指过去。
Italian (IT): Zia Natsuhi puntava nervosamente la canna del fucile ad ogni angolo buio e ombroso.
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze endişeyle silahın namlusunu her karanlık noktaya ve gölgeye doğrulttu.

Umineko Project (UP): It felt like that motion was out of fear rather than caution...
Steam (ST): It felt like that motion was out of fear rather than caution...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It felt like that motion was out of fear rather than caution...
PC Japanese (JP): その動きは警戒よりも怯えを強く感じさせる…。
Russian (RU): Складывалось ощущение, что это было вызвано скорее страхом, чем осторожностью...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que era movida mais pelo medo que pela cautela......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的動作比起警戒，更讓人感到強烈的畏懼…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的动作比起警戒，更让人感到强烈的畏惧…。
Italian (IT): I suoi movimenti sembravano più dettati dal panico che dalla cautela...
Turkish (TR): Bu hareket temkinden ziyade korkudan kaynaklanıyor gibiydi...

Umineko Project (UP): But the rifle she held in her hand would surely also be our trump card that the killer was afraid of...
Steam (ST): But the rifle she held in her hand should've been a trump card that the culprit feared...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But the rifle she held in her hand should have been a trump card that the culprit was afraid of...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、手にするライフル銃は、きっと犯人を恐れさせる切り札でもあるはずなのだ…。
Russian (RU): Но ружьё, которое она держала в своих руках, могло стать козырной картой, которой боялся преступник...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o rifle que ela tinha em mãos certamente era nosso trunfo que o assassino temia...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明她手中的來福槍，應該是必定能讓犯人害怕的王牌啊…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明她手中的来复枪，应该是必定能让犯人害怕的王牌啊…。
Italian (IT): Ma il fucile che aveva in mano sarebbe stato un asso nella manica, che il colpevole senz'altro temeva...
Turkish (TR): Ama elbette elinde tuttuğu tüfek de katilin korktuğu kozumuz olacaktı...

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "......You know, I've been thinking. ...It wouldn't be impossible to stick one of those "icepicks" into someone's chest, like in Kanon‐kun's case. ......But splitting the skull and sticking them into the forehead, like it was with my parents, wouldn't be that easy."
Steam (ST): "...You know, I've been thinking. It wouldn't be impossible to stick one of those "icepicks" into someone's chest, like in Kanon-kun's case. ...But splitting the skull and sticking them into the forehead, like in my parents' case, wouldn't be that easy."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......You know, I've been thinking. It wouldn't be impossible to stick one of those 'icepicks' into someone's chest, like in Kanon-kun's case. ......But splitting the skull and sticking them into the forehead, like in my parents' case, wouldn't be that easy."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……僕はずっと思ってたんだ。…嘉音くんのように、胸にあの“アイスピック”を突き刺すことは、不可能ではないと思う。……でも、母さんたちのように、頭蓋骨を打ち抜いて眉間に突き立てるなんて、簡単なことじゃないと思うんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……僕はずっと思ってたんだ。…嘉音くんのように、胸にあの“アイスピック”を突き刺すことは、不可能ではないと思う。……でも、母さんたちのように、頭蓋骨を打ち抜いて眉間に突き立てるなんて、簡単なことじゃないと思うんだ」
Russian (RU): "......Вы знаете, я тут подумал. ...В том, чтобы воткнуть одно из тех 'шильев', как в случае с Канон‐куном, нет ничего невозможного. ......Но раздробить череп и воткнуть их в лоб, как в случае с моими родителями, было бы не так просто."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Em sempre estive pensando... ...Não seria impossível colocar um daqueles "picadores de gelo" no peito de alguém, assim como no caso do Kanon‐kun. ......Mas dividir o crânio e enfiá‐lo no meio da testa, assim como aconteceu com os meus pais, não seria tão fácil."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我一直都在想。…像嘉音君那樣，在胸口刺進“冰錐”，並不是不可能的。……但是，像媽媽他們那樣，貫穿頭蓋骨直插在眉間，可就沒那麼簡單了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我一直都在想。…像嘉音君那样，在胸口刺进“冰锥”，并不是不可能的。……但是，像妈妈他们那样，贯穿头盖骨直插在眉间，可就没那么简单了。」
Italian (IT): "...Stavo pensando ad una cosa. Non sarebbe impossibile trafiggere il petto di qualcuno con uno di quei ‘punteruoli’, come è avvenuto con Kanon-kun...{n}Ma non è affatto facile perforare il cranio e infilzare la fronte di un uomo nel modo subito dai miei genitori."
Turkish (TR): "......Bunca zamandır düşünüyordum da. ...Kanon-kun'un durumunda olduğu gibi, o "buz kıracaklarından" birini birinin göğsüne saplamak imkansız olmazdı. ......Ama kafatasını yarmak ve annemle babamda olduğu gibi alnına saplamak o kadar da kolay olmazdı."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "You think the culprit had that kind of animal strength...?!"
Steam (ST): "You think the culprit had that kind of animal strength...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You think that the culprit had that kind of animal strength...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「犯人はそれだけ馬鹿力ってことか…？！」
Russian (RU): "Ты думаешь, преступник обладал такой звериной силой?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você acha que o culpado tinha esse tipo de força bestial...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你是說犯人有與此相當的蠻力嗎…？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你是说犯人有与此相当的蛮力吗…？！」
Italian (IT): "Pensi che il colpevole abbia un tale ammontare di forza bruta...?!"
Turkish (TR): "Suçlunun o tür bir hayvani güce sahip olduğunu mu düşünüyorsun...?!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "...They probably have some kind of weapon, a device that can shoot or pound in those "icepicks". That handle was too short to be driven in that deeply by human strength alone."
Steam (ST): "...They probably had some kind of weapon, a device that can shoot or pound in those "icepicks". That handle was too short to be driven in that deeply by a human's strength alone."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...They probably had some kind of weapon, a device that can shoot or pound in those 'icepicks'. That handle was too short to be driven in that deeply by a human's strength alone."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…多分、あの“アイスピック”を飛ばす、あるいは打ち込む、射出機のような武器があるんだよ。人力だけで、あれだけ深々と刺突するにはあの柄は短すぎる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…多分、あの“アイスピック”を飛ばす、あるいは打ち込む、射出機のような武器があるんだよ。人力だけで、あれだけ深々と刺突するにはあの柄は短すぎる」
Russian (RU): "...Возможно, у них было какое‐то оружие, стреляющее или забивающее те 'шилья'. Их рукоятка слишком коротка, чтобы забить их так глубоко одной лишь грубой силой человека."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Ele provavelmente deve ter algum tipo de arma, um dispositivo que pode atirar ou empurrar esses "picadores de gelo". O cabo era muito curto para ser cravado tão profundamente só com a força de um único ser humano."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…我想，那“冰錐”大概是用發射器一樣的武器射入，又或者是錘打進去的。若光靠人力，柄部太短了，很難把它刺得那麼深。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…我想，那“冰锥”大概是用发射器一样的武器射入，又或者是锤打进去的。若光靠人力，柄部太短了，很难把它刺得那么深。」
Italian (IT): "...Probabilmente avrà un'arma a munizioni, con cui può sparare quei ‘punteruoli’, o forse trapanarli. La loro impugnatura è troppo corta per venire infilzati tanto in profondità con la sola forza umana."
Turkish (TR): "...Muhtemelen ateş edebilen ya da o "buz kıracaklarını" fırlatabilen bir tür silahları ya da bir cihazları vardır. Sapı sadece insan gücüyle o kadar derine sokulamayacak kadar kısaydı."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "......Whatever the case, they have enough force to break through a skull. ...It seems that Kanon's wound even reached his lungs. ......Even if you see our opponent, do not step out in front. You must not move away from my back."
Steam (ST): "...Either way, they have enough force to break through a skull. ...I heard Kanon's wound reached as far as his lungs. ...If you happen to see your opponent, don't go forwards. You mustn't move away from my back."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Either way, they have enough force to break through a skull. ...It seems that Kanon's wound even reached his lungs. ......Even if you see our opponent, don't go forwards. You mustn't move away from my back."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……いずれにせよ、頭蓋骨を打ち抜くほどに強力です。…嘉音の傷も、肺にまで届いていたそうです。……もし、相手の姿を見ても決して前に出ないように。私の後から出てはいけませんよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……いずれにせよ、頭蓋骨を打ち抜くほどに強力です。…嘉音の傷も、肺にまで届いていたそうです。……もし、相手の姿を見ても決して前に出ないように。私の後から出てはいけませんよ」
Russian (RU): "......Как бы там ни было, у них достаточно силы, чтобы пробить череп. ...Похоже, что рана Канона дошла даже до лёгких. ......Даже если вы увидите нашего противника, не бросайтесь вперёд. Вы не должны выходить из‐за моей спины."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Seja qual for o caso, ele tem força para quebrar um crânio. ...Parece que a ferida do Kanon chegou até os seus pulmões. ......Mesmo se vocês virem o nosso oponente, não avancem sem mim. Vocês não devem se afastar das minhas costas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……無論哪種，都是能打穿頭蓋骨的強力武器。…嘉音的傷，似乎也是刺到了肺部。……即使看到了對方的身影，也千萬不要衝到前面來。不可以從我的身後出來。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……无论哪种，都是能打穿头盖骨的强力武器。…嘉音的伤，似乎也是刺到了肺部。……即使看到了对方的身影，也千万不要冲到前面来。不可以从我的身后出来。」
Italian (IT): "...Ad ogni modo, è abbastanza potente da trapassare un cranio... Pare che la lesione di Kanon avesse perfino raggiunto i polmoni... Non fatevi avanti, neanche se vedeste il nemico. Non spostatevi dalla mia schiena."
Turkish (TR): "......Durum ne olursa olsun, onlar bir kafatasını kırmak için yeterli güce sahipler. ...Kanon'un yarasının ciğerlerine kadar ulaştığını işitmiştim. ......Suçluyu görseniz bile öne atılmayın. Arkamdan uzaklaşmamalısınız."

Umineko Project (UP): Just how sinister and frightening was this weapon that could shoot those creepy icepicks?
Steam (ST): Just how sinister and frightening was the weapon that could shoot those creepy icepicks?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): あんな不気味なアイスピックを撃ち出すという武器は、一体どれほどに禍々しく恐ろしいものなのか。
Russian (RU): Каким же гибельным и страшным должно было быть то оружие, стреляющее теми жуткими шильями?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O quão terrível e assustadora essa arma, que atira esses sinistros picadores de gelo, poderia ser?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 射出那駭人冰錐的武器，究竟是件多麼恐怖的東西呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 射出那骇人冰锥的武器，究竟是件多么恐怖的东西呢？
Italian (IT): Quanto poteva essere sinistra e spaventosa un'arma che poteva sparare quei terrificanti punteruoli...?
Turkish (TR): O ürkütücü buz kıracaklarını fırlatabilen bu silah ne kadar şeytani ve korkutucuydu?

Umineko Project (UP): ......And could I do anything to combat it with just this candlestick in my hand?
Steam (ST): ...And could I do anything to combat it with just this candle stand in my hand?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And could I do anything to combat it with just this candlestick in my hand?
PC Japanese (JP): ……そしてそれは、今、俺が手にしている燭台のようなもので抵抗できるものなのか。
Russian (RU): ......И мог ли я что‐либо ему противопоставить с одним лишь этим подсвечником в руках?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E o que eu poderia fazer em um combate, apenas com este castiçal na minha mão?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而且，現在我手裡的燭台這種東西，能夠與之抗衡嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且，现在我手里的烛台这种东西，能够与之抗衡吗？
Italian (IT): E avrei potuto opporre della resistenza con quel candelabro che avevo tra le mani?
Turkish (TR): ......Ve elimdeki bu şamdanla onunla mücadele etmek için bir şey yapabilir miydim?

Umineko Project (UP): In the first murder, the culprit had probably assaulted four of our parents at once as they discussed the inheritance problem in the dining hall.{n}...And we also had four people.
Steam (ST): In the first murder, the culprit probably assaulted all four of our parents at once as they discussed the inheritance problem in the dining hall. ...And there were four of us here now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the first murder, the culprit had probably assaulted all four of our parents at once as they discussed the inheritance problem in the dining hall. ...And we also had four people.
PC Japanese (JP): 最初の殺人で犯人は、多分、食堂で遺産問題を話し合っていた親父たち４人を一度に襲って殺している。…そして、俺たちも、４人。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 最初の殺人で犯人は、多分、食堂で遺産問題を話し合っていた親父たち４人を一度に襲って殺している。{n}…そして、俺たちも、４人。
Russian (RU): В первом убийстве преступник наверняка сразу же напал на всех четверых наших родителей, пока те были заняты обсуждением проблемы дележа наследства в обеденном зале.{n}...И сейчас нас тоже четверо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No primeiro assassinato, o culpado provavelmente agrediu quatro de nossos pais, enquanto eles discutiam sobre a herança na sala de jantar.{n}...E nós também estamos em quatro pessoas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 第一次殺人事件中，犯人應該是把在餐廳談論遺產問題的老爸他們四人一次性殺死的。{n}…而我們，也是四人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 第一次杀人事件中，犯人应该是把在餐厅谈论遗产问题的老爸他们四人一次性杀死的。{n}…而我们，也是四人。
Italian (IT): Nel primo omicidio, il colpevole aveva probabilmente assalito tutti e quattro i nostri genitori, uno alla volta, mentre discutevano sulla questione dell'eredità nella sala da pranzo... E anche noi eravamo in quattro...
Turkish (TR): İlk cinayette, suçlu muhtemelen yemek salonunda miras sorununu tartışan ebeveynlerimizden dördüne birden saldırmıştı.{n}...Ve biz de şu an dört kişiydik.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Apparently, I wasn't the only person thinking this.
Steam (ST): ...Apparently, I wasn't the only person thinking this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……同じことを考えてるのは、俺だけではないようだった。
Russian (RU): ......Похоже, я был не единственный, кто так думал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Aparentemente, eu sou o único que está pensando nisso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在想同樣事情的，似乎不止我一個。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在想同样事情的，似乎不止我一个。
Italian (IT): Apparentemente, non ero l'unico a pensarlo...
Turkish (TR): ......Anlaşılan bunu düşünen tek kişi ben değildim.

Umineko Project (UP): ......George‐aniki, Jessica, ...and, of course, Aunt Natsuhi......were stretching their senses to the utmost limit, in the highest and worst state of tension, slowly advancing one step, then another...
Steam (ST): ...George-aniki, Jessica, ...and, of course, Aunt Natsuhi, ...were stretching their senses to the utmost limit, in the highest and worst state of tension, slowly advancing one step, then another...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......George-aniki, Jessica, ...and, of course, Natsuhi oba-san, ......were stretching their senses to the utmost limit, in the highest and worst state of tension, slowly advancing one step, then another...
PC Japanese (JP): ……譲治の兄貴も、朱志香も、…そして当然、夏妃伯母さんも、……神経を極限まで研ぎ澄まし、最高最悪の緊張状態を維持しながら、一歩、一歩と、じりじりと歩を進めていく…。
Russian (RU): ......Джордж‐аники, Джессика...... и, конечно же, тётя Нацухи...... все напрягли свои чувства до предела, испытывая высочайшее и наихудшее напряжение, и медленно продвигались вперёд шаг за шагом...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O George‐aniki, a Jessica e, ...é claro, a tia Natsuhi......todos estavam com seus sentidos sobrecarregados até o limite máximo, em um estado de tensão altíssimo e terrível, avançando lentamente, um passo depois do outro...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……讓治大哥、朱志香，…當然也包括，夏妃伯母，……我們把神經緊繃到極限，痛苦地維持著瀕臨崩潰的緊張狀態，一步、一步，緩緩前進…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……让治大哥、朱志香，…当然也包括，夏妃伯母，……我们把神经紧绷到极限，痛苦地维持着濒临崩溃的紧张状态，一步、一步，缓缓前进…。
Italian (IT): Il fratellone George, Jessica... e anche Zia Natsuhi... stavano aguzzando i sensi quanto più potevano, e avanzavano lentamente, passo dopo passo, mantenendo la loro tensione alle stelle...
Turkish (TR): ......George-aniki, Jessica, ...ve tabii ki Natsuhi Teyze de......duyularını en üst sınıra kadar zorluyor, gerilimin en yoğun ve en korkunç anında, yavaşça bir adım, sonra bir adım daha atıyorlardı...

Umineko Project (UP): .........Aaah, what sinful people are we...
Steam (ST): ......Aaah, what have we done?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........Aaah, what have we done?
PC Japanese (JP): ………あぁ、俺たちは何と罪深いことか。
Russian (RU): .........А‐а‐ах, что мы за люди...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Aaah, que pecadores nós somos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………啊啊，我們是何等罪孽深重啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………啊啊，我们是何等罪孽深重啊。
Italian (IT): Aaah, avevamo commesso un grande sbaglio...
Turkish (TR): .........Aaah, biz ne korkunç insanlarız...

Umineko Project (UP): ...A world as terrifying as this, ......and we pushed Maria and the rest right into the middle of it, just because of the seeds of doubt spread by that single letter...
Steam (ST): ...Because of the seeds of doubt spread by that one letter, we threw Maria and the rest into the middle of this terrifying world...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Because of the seeds of doubt spread by that one letter, we threw Maria and the rest into the middle of this terrifying world...
PC Japanese (JP): …これほどの恐ろしき世界に、……あの手紙一通によって蒔かれた疑心暗鬼によって、真里亞たち４人を突き落としたのだから…。
Russian (RU): ...Позволив сомнениям, вызванным одним единственным письмом, овладеть нами...... мы выкинули Марию и остальных прямо в этот ужасный мир...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Um mundo tão aterrorizador como esse, ......e nós empurramos Maria e o resto para o meio dele, apenas por causa das sementes de dúvida semeadas por aquela única carta...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …僅僅因為一封信就疑神疑鬼，……把真里亞他們四人推進了如此可怕的世界…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …仅仅因为一封信就疑神疑鬼，……把真里亚他们四人推进了如此可怕的世界…。
Italian (IT): Il seme del dubbio era stato piantato da quella singola lettera... avevamo lanciato Maria e gli altri in un mondo terrorizzante...
Turkish (TR): ...Bu kadar korkunç bir dünya, ......ve sırf o mektubun saçtığı şüphe tohumları yüzünden Maria ve diğerlerini bu dünyanın tam ortasına ittik...

Umineko Project (UP): We finally reached the first floor. .........The parlor was just across the hall.
Steam (ST): We finally reached the first floor. ......The parlor was just across the hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We finally reached the first floor. .........The parlor was just across the hall.
PC Japanese (JP): 一階にたどり着く。………客間は、廊下の向こう、すぐだ。
Russian (RU): Наконец‐то мы достигли первого этажа. .........Чтобы попасть в гостиную, достаточно только было пройти по коридору.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós finalmente chegamos ao primeiro andar. .........Só restava cruzar o hall de entrada para chegarmos à sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 終於到了一樓。………客廳，就在走廊另一邊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 终于到了一楼。………客厅，就在走廊另一边。
Italian (IT): Raggiungemmo finalmente il piano terra... Il salotto era esattamente a fianco del corridoio.
Turkish (TR): Sonunda birinci kata ulaşmıştık. .........Salon koridorun hemen karşısındaydı.

Umineko Project (UP): When we listened carefully, .........we could hear it faintly.{n}......Maria's eerie singing voice.
Steam (ST): When we listened carefully, ......we could hear it faintly. ...Maria's eerie singing voice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When we listened carefully, .........we could hear it faintly. ......Maria's eerie singing voice.
PC Japanese (JP): 耳を凝らすと、………かすかに聞こえる。……真里亞の、不思議な歌声が。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 耳を凝らすと、………かすかに聞こえる。{n}……真里亞の、不思議な歌声が。
Russian (RU): Мы внимательно прислушались......... и до наших ушей донеслось слабое звучание.{n}......Мария что‐то пела своим жутким голосом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando paramos para ouvir com mais atenção, .........nós pudemos ouvir bem baixinho.{n}......A estranha voz da Maria cantando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 凝神細聽，………終於能隱約聽到了。{n}……真里亞，那不可思議的歌聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 凝神细听，………终于能隐约听到了。{n}……真里亚，那不可思议的歌声。
Italian (IT): Quando aguzzammo l'udito... potevamo sentirla a malapena... Era il canto inquietante di Maria.
Turkish (TR): Dikkatle dinlediğimizde, .........belli belirsiz duyabiliyorduk.{n}......Maria'nın ürkütücü şarkı sesi.

Umineko Project (UP): She wasn't singing naturally, as though she were in a good mood.
Steam (ST): She wasn't singing naturally, as though she were in a good mood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She wasn't singing naturally, as though she were in a good mood.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、機嫌がよくて自然と口に出てしまうような歌い方ではない。
Russian (RU): В её пении не ощущалось естественности, которую можно почувствовать, когда человек поёт в хорошем настроении.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não estava cantando naturalmente, como quando ela está de bom humor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這並非心情愉快的情況下，自然唱出的歌聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这并非心情愉快的情况下，自然唱出的歌声。
Italian (IT): Non stava cantando in maniera naturale e di buon umore...
Turkish (TR): Sanki keyfi yerindeymiş gibi doğal bir şekilde şarkı söylemiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): .........She was singing mechanically, as if she was in music class in school and had been ordered to sing.
Steam (ST): ......She was singing mechanically, like she was at a graduation ceremony and she'd been ordered to.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........She was singing mechanically, like she was at a graduation ceremony and she'd been ordered to.
PC Japanese (JP): ………それはまるで、学校の授業などで、歌うことを命じられて歌うような、無機質な歌い方。
Russian (RU): .........Её пение было механическим, словно она была на уроке музыки и просто делала то, что ей сказали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Ela estava cantando de forma mecânica, como se estivesse na aula de música e tivesse sido obrigado ela a cantar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………簡直就像，學校上課時，被命令唱歌而唱出的毫無感情的歌聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………简直就像，学校上课时，被命令唱歌而唱出的毫无感情的歌声。
Italian (IT): Cantava in modo robotico, come se stesse a lezione e le fosse stato ordinato di farlo...
Turkish (TR): .........Sanki okulda müzik dersindeymiş ve kendisine şarkı söylemesi emredilmiş gibi mekanik bir şekilde şarkı söylüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...The song she was singing was just a common folk song, one that everyone has probably sung in school at one time or another.
Steam (ST): ...The song she sang was just a common folk song, one that everyone has probably sung in school at one time or another.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …歌っている歌は、誰もが学校で一度は歌ったことがあるに違いない平凡な民謡。
Russian (RU): ...Песней, которую пела Мария, была обычная народная песня, которую каждый когда‐нибудь да пел в школе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...O que ela estava cantando era apenas uma música popular comum, uma daquelas que provavelmente todo mundo já deve ter cantado na escola alguma vez.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那首歌，是大家在學校肯定都唱過的平凡無奇的民謠。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那首歌，是大家在学校肯定都唱过的平凡无奇的民谣。
Italian (IT): Il canto da lei intonato era una classica canzone tradizionale, che sicuramente chiunque aveva recitato a scuola, almeno per una volta...
Turkish (TR): ...Söylediği şarkı sıradan bir halk şarkısıydı, muhtemelen herkesin okulda bir zamanlar söylediği bir şarkı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......But why that, in the middle of the night, alone, with all her heart, over and over, why...?!
Steam (ST): ...But why that, in the middle of the night, alone, with all her heart, over and over, why...?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But why that, in the middle of the night, alone, with all her heart, over and over, why...?!
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、それを、なぜ、こんな深夜に、ひとりで、一生懸命に、ずっと、どうして…？！
Russian (RU): ......Вот только петь её глубокой ночью, в одиночестве, от всего сердца, повторяя её вновь и вновь... зачем?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas por que isso, no meio da noite, sozinha, com todo o seu coração, de novo e de novo? Por quê...?!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……可是，為什麼，要在深夜，一個人，拚命地，把它，唱個不停，為什麼…？！
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……可是，为什么，要在深夜，一个人，拼命地，把它，唱个不停，为什么…？！
Italian (IT): Ma perché... farlo... nel cuore della notte... da sola... in continuazione... come se ne dipendesse la sua vita... perché...?!
Turkish (TR): ......Ama neden, gecenin bir yarısı, tek başına, tüm kalbiyle, tekrar tekrar, neden...?!

Umineko Project (UP): When we had just left the study, we had called out in loud voices, asking Maria where she was.
Steam (ST): Right after leaving the study, we had called out in loud voices, asking Maria where she was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 書斎を出たばかりの時、俺たちは大声をあげ、真里亞はどこかと呼びかけた。
Russian (RU): Когда мы покинули кабинет, то стали громко звать её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando deixamos o estúdio, nós chamamos ela em voz alta, perguntando onde a Maria estava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛出書房的時候，我們都提高嗓門，大聲呼喚過真里亞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚出书房的时候，我们都提高嗓门，大声呼唤过真里亚。
Italian (IT): Quando avevamo lasciato da poco lo studio, avevamo chiamato a gran voce Maria, chiedendole dove fosse...
Turkish (TR): Az önce çalışma odasından çıkarken yüksek sesle seslenmiş, Maria'ya nerede olduğunu sormuştuk.

Umineko Project (UP): ...But this time, no one said even a single word.
Steam (ST): ...But this time, no one said even a single word.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、今度は誰も何も、一言も発しない。
Russian (RU): ...Но сейчас никто из нас не сказал ни слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mas dessa vez, ninguém disse uma única palavra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …然而，現在每個人都一言不發。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …然而，现在每个人都一言不发。
Italian (IT): Ma stavolta, nessuno disse nemmeno una parola...
Turkish (TR): ...Ama bu sefer, kimse tek bir kelime bile etmedi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......We hid our breath and the sound of our footsteps, heightened all our senses, and examined everywhere around us to a neurotic degree......as we advanced each step...
Steam (ST): ...We hid our breath and the sound of our footsteps, and, intensely focused on our surroundings to the point of being completely high-strung, ...we stepped forward...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......We hid our breath and the sound of our footsteps, and, intensely aware to the point of being completely high-strung, ......we stepped forward...
PC Japanese (JP): ……息と足音を殺し、神経を研ぎ澄ましながら、神経質なくらいに辺りをうかがいつつ、……歩を進める…。
Russian (RU): ......Мы затаили дыхание и приглушили звуки шагов, пребывая в состоянии крайнего чувственного напряжения, готовые вот‐вот сорваться...... шаг за шагом мы двигались вперед...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Nós prendemos nossa respiração e ocultamos o som dos nossos passos, apurando todos os nossos sentidos e examinando de forma neurótica tudo à nossa volta.....a cada passo que dávamos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我們努力屏住呼吸，放輕腳步，讓頭腦保持清醒，一邊神經質地巡視四周，……一邊前進…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我们努力屏住呼吸，放轻脚步，让头脑保持清醒，一边神经质地巡视四周，……一边前进…。
Italian (IT): Trattenemmo il respiro, e avanzammo, coprendo il rumore dei nostri passi... tenendo occhi e orecchie ben aperti, in preda all'ansia...
Turkish (TR): ......Nefesimizi ve ayak seslerimizi gizledik, tüm duyularımızı yoğunlaştırdık......ve her adımda etrafımızdaki her şeyi delicesine inceledik...

Umineko Project (UP): The door to the parlor was closed.{n}But we could hear Maria's singing voice through it...
Steam (ST): The door to the parlor was closed. But we could hear Maria's singing voice through it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The door to the parlor was closed. But we could hear Maria's singing voice through it...
PC Japanese (JP): 客間の扉は閉まっていた。だが、真里亞の歌声はその中から聞こえてくる…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 客間の扉は閉まっていた。{n}だが、真里亞の歌声はその中から聞こえてくる…。
Russian (RU): Дверь в гостиную была закрыта.{n}Но мы могли слышать голос Марии через неё...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A porta da sala de visitas estava fechada.{n}Mas podíamos ouvir a Maria cantando através dela...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 客廳的門關著。{n}不過，可以從中聽到真里亞的歌聲…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 客厅的门关着。{n}不过，可以从中听到真里亚的歌声…。
Italian (IT): La porta del salotto era chiusa. Ma attraverso di essa, potevamo sentire la voce di Maria che cantava...
Turkish (TR): Salonun kapısı kapalıydı.{n}Ama Maria'nın şarkı söyleyen sesini duyabiliyorduk...

Umineko Project (UP): Aunt Natsuhi put her hand on the handle of the doorknob... George‐aniki stopped her.
Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi put her hand on the handle of the doorknob... when George-aniki stopped her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san put her hand on the handle of the doorknob..., when George-aniki stopped her.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんが扉の取っ手状のドアノブに手を掛ける…。それを譲治の兄貴が制した。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи взялась было за дверную ручку... но Джордж‐аники её остановил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Natsuhi colocou a mão na maçaneta... O George‐aniki a parou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃伯母把手伸向拉柄狀的門把手…。但是被讓治大哥阻止了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃伯母把手伸向拉柄状的门把手…。但是被让治大哥阻止了。

Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze elini kapı kolunun üzerine koydu... George-aniki onu durdurdu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya George

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...I'll open the door... Natsuhi oba-san, Battler-kun, ready your weapons."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Eu vou abrir a porta... Tia Natsuhi, Battler‐kun, preparem suas armas."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica

Steam (ST): "They might attack as soon as we open it... George nii-san, watch yourself...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "They might attack as soon as we open it... George nii-san, watch yourself...!"

Turkish (TR): "Kapıyı açar açmaz saldırabilirler... George nii-san, dikkat et...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "...Sure... ......Then...I'll open it... ......Huh?!"

Steam (ST): He tried to open it, but immediately felt the hard resistance of the lock.

Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi took the bundle of keys from her pocket and gave them to George.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san took the bundle of keys from her pocket and gave them to George.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃伯母さんがポケットから鍵束を出すと譲治の兄貴に託す。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи достала из кармана связку ключей и дала их Джорджу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Natsuhi pegou um molho de chaves de seu bolso e deu para o George‐aniki.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃伯母从口袋中取出钥匙串交给让治大哥。

Steam (ST): ...There were about ten keys, and none of us had a clue which was which.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……１０本近くも鍵があり、どれが何の鍵かさっぱりだった。
Russian (RU): ......В связке было около десяти ключей, и никто из нас не имел понятия, который из них должен подойти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Havia cerca de dez chaves, e nenhum de nós sabia qual era a certa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……鑰匙串上有近十把鑰匙，完全不知道哪把鑰匙是做什麼的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……钥匙串上有近十把钥匙，完全不知道哪把钥匙是做什么的。
