Turkish (TR): ......Yaklaşık on anahtar vardı ve hiçbirimiz hangisinin hangisi olduğunu bilmiyorduk.

Umineko Project (UP): Because of this, George had to fumble around loudly and test several of the keys.
Steam (ST): Because of this, George had to fumble around loudly and test several of the keys.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of this, George had to fumble around loudly and test several of the keys.
PC Japanese (JP): そのため、兄貴はガチャガチャと、数本の鍵を試さざるを得なかった。
Russian (RU): Из‐за этого Джорджу пришлось громко побряцать и проверить несколько ключей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, o aniki não teve escolha a não ser testar várias chaves.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，大哥不得不“嘩啦嘩啦”地一把把嘗試。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，大哥不得不“哗啦哗啦”地一把把尝试。
Italian (IT): Perciò, George dovette testare diverse chiavi tintinnanti...
Turkish (TR): Bu nedenle George'un yüksek sesle uğraşması ve anahtarlardan birkaçını test etmesi gerekti.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Since we had hidden our footsteps, preparing to make a surprise attack on the room, this felt almost fatal...
Steam (ST): ...Since we had hidden our footsteps, preparing to make a surprise attack on the room, this felt almost fatal...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは、足音を殺し、客間を奇襲しようという俺たちにとっては、致命的に感じられた…。
Russian (RU): ......Поскольку мы скрывали наши шаги, готовясь внезапно напасть на врага, застав его врасплох, эта загвоздка казалась почти фатальной...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Como estávamos ocultando nossos passos, nos preparando para fazer um ataque surpresa, isso poderia ser fatal...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我不由得感到，這對努力放輕腳步打算奇襲客廳的我們而言，是致命的…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我不由得感到，这对努力放轻脚步打算奇袭客厅的我们而言，是致命的…。
Italian (IT): Siccome avevamo celato il rumore dei nostri passi, e ci eravamo preparati per un attacco a sorpresa nel salotto, tutto ciò sembrava un errore fatale...
Turkish (TR): ......Odaya sürpriz bir saldırı yapmaya hazırlanırken ayak seslerimizi gizlediğimiz için, bu neredeyse ölümcül hissettiriyordu...

Umineko Project (UP): The whole time, we could hear Maria's voice from the parlor, singing the same song over and over.
Steam (ST): The whole time, we could hear Maria's voice from the parlor, singing the same song over and over.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The whole time, we could hear Maria's voice from the parlor, singing the same song over and over.
PC Japanese (JP): 客間の中からは、同じ歌をいつまでも何度も繰り返す真里亞の声がずっと聞こえている。
Russian (RU): И всё это время мы слышали голос Марии, вновь и вновь запевающей одну и ту же песню.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O tempo todo, nós podíamos ouvir a voz da Maria vinda da sala de visitas, cantando a mesma canção de novo e de novo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 客廳中，始終能聽見真里亞反覆地唱著同樣的歌。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 客厅中，始终能听见真里亚反复地唱着同样的歌。
Italian (IT): Per tutto il tempo, riuscimmo a udire dal salotto la voce di Maria, che intonava continuamente la stessa canzone...
Turkish (TR): Tüm bu süre boyunca Maria'nın salondan gelen ve aynı şarkıyı tekrar tekrar söyleyen sesini duyabiliyorduk.

Umineko Project (UP): ......It was like a broken, crazy cassette tape...
Steam (ST): ...It was like a broken, crazy cassette tape...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……それは例えるなら壊れた、狂ったカセットテープ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……それは例えるなら壊れた、イカれたカセットテープ…。
Russian (RU): ......Словно безумная сломанная аудиокассета...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era como uma fita cassete enlouquecida e quebrada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……要比喻的話，那就像是一盤壞掉了的，不正常的磁帶…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……要比喻的话，那就像是一盘坏掉了的，不正常的磁带…。
Italian (IT): Era come una videocassetta rotta che si era impallata...
Turkish (TR): ......Tıpkı bozuk, çılgın bir kaset gibiydi...

Umineko Project (UP): In the morning, we had been in that room the whole time.{n}...All of the frightening things had occurred outside that room.{n}...So, we had convinced ourselves that even if nowhere else could be trusted, that room alone was safe.
Steam (ST): We'd been in that room almost constantly since morning. ...All the frightening things had occurred outside that room. ...That had left us with the impression that only this room was safe.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the morning, we had been in that room the whole time....All of the frightening things had occurred outside that room. So we had been under the impression that only that room was safe.
PC Japanese (JP): 今朝からずっとこの部屋の中にいた。…いつも恐ろしいことはこの部屋の外で起こった。…だから、この部屋だけは安全だと思い込んできた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 今朝からずっとこの部屋の中にいた。{n}…いつも恐ろしいことはこの部屋の外で起こった。{n}…だから、この部屋だけは安全だと思い込んできた。
Russian (RU): Утром мы всё время были в этой комнате.{n}...Все эти ужасные вещи случились вне её.{n}...Поэтому у нас создалось впечатление, что при недоверии к любому другому месту, в этой комнате было безопасно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Durante a manhã, nós tínhamos estado o tempo inteiro naquela sala.{n}...Todas as coisas assustadoras ocorreram fora da sala.{n}...Por isso, nós tínhamos nos convencido de que, mesmo que nenhum outro lugar fosse de confiança, a sala era segura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們從今早開始一直在這個房間裡。{n}…可怕的事總是發生在這個房間之外。{n}…所以，我們不假思索地認為只有這個房間是安全的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们从今早开始一直在这个房间里。{n}…可怕的事总是发生在这个房间之外。{n}…所以，我们不假思索地认为只有这个房间是安全的。
Italian (IT): Eravamo stati in quella stanza fin da quella mattina...Quei spaventosi episodi erano sempre avvenuti al di fuori di essa... Così ci eravamo convinti che quella fosse l'unica stanza sicura...
Turkish (TR): Geceden önce, bütün zaman boyunca bu odadaydık.{n}...Tüm korkutucu şeyler bu odanın dışında gerçekleşmişti.{n}...Böylece kendimizi, başka hiçbir yere güvenilemese bile, sadece bu odanın güvenli olduğuna ikna etmiştik.

Steam (ST): ......That baseless impression was quickly falling apart...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………その、根拠なき思い込みが、あっさりと崩れ去っていく……。
Russian (RU): .........Теперь же мы быстро осознавали ошибочность этого ничем не обоснованного впечатления......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Essa impressão sem fundamento foi rapidamente desmoronando......

Chinese Simplified (CN): ………而这毫无根据的信念，轻易地化为了乌有……。
Italian (IT): E quella convinzione infondata stava rapidamente cadendo a pezzi...
Turkish (TR): .........Bu asılsız izlenim hızla dağılıyordu......

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……伯母さん。一気に飛び込んで左右に分かれよう。扉を開けてぼさっとしてたら、例のアイスピックがど真ん中に飛んでくるかもしれねぇぜ…！」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Tia. Vamos entrar todos juntos e nos dividir indo cada um para uma direção. Se nós ficarmos parados em frente à porta após abri‐la, aquelas picadores de gelo poderiam vir voando direto no centro...!"

Umineko Project (UP): Aunt Natsuhi and I rammed into the door as we flew into the parlor, quickly splitting up left and right, and searching the parlor for someone who might be waiting for us.
Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi and I rammed into the door before flying into the parlor, quickly splitting up left and right and searching the parlor for someone who might be waiting for us.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san and I rammed into the door before flying into the parlor, quickly splitting up left and right, and searching the parlor for someone who might be waiting for us.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺と夏妃伯母さんは、扉に体当たりをするようにして客間に飛び込み、左右に素早くわかれ、客間の中で待ち受けているかもしれない何者かを探した。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи и я налетели на дверь перед тем, как влететь в гостиную, а потом быстро разделились вправо и влево в поисках кого‐нибудь, кто мог находиться в гостиной в ожидании нас.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Natsuhi e eu empurramos a porta enquanto entrávamos voando na sala de visitas. Rapidamente nos dividimos indo para a direita e a esquerda, e procuramos na sala de visitas por alguém que pudesse estar nos esperando.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我和夏妃伯母用身体撞开门冲进客厅，然后迅速左右分开，寻找着可能埋伏在客厅中的某人。
Italian (IT): Io e zia Natsuhi ci preparammo a lanciarci contro la porta, per poi irrompere nel salotto, sparpagliandoci rapidamente in ogni direzione, alla ricerca di una figura che stesse aspettando il nostro arrivo.
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi Teyze ve ben salona uçarcasına girerken kapıya çarptık, hızla sağa sola dağıldık ve salonda bizi bekleyen biri olup olmadığını kolaçan ettik.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): But what our eyes landed upon, ............was an incredibly, .........strange sight...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o que nosso olhos viram............foi uma cena............completamente bizarra...

Steam (ST): The parlor......was stained with blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The parlor.........was stained with blood.

Umineko Project (UP): This place, where we had spent almost the entire day, where we had pressed in together to protect ourselves from some unknown malice, had become stained with fresh blood, had become an ocean of blood...!!
Steam (ST): This place, where we spent almost the entire day, where we pressed in together to protect ourselves from some unknown malice, ...had been stained with fresh blood, had become an ocean of blood...!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This place, where we had spent almost the entire day, where we had pressed in together to protect ourselves from some unknown malice, had become stained with fresh blood, had become an ocean of blood...!!
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちが今日の一日のほとんどを過ごし、何者かの悪意から身を守るために身を寄せ合っていたその場所が、鮮血で染められていたッ、血の海になっていたッ…！！
Russian (RU): Место, где мы провели почти весь день, в котором мы теснились, укрываясь от неизвестной опасности, было залито свежей кровью, образовав кровавое озеро!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esse lugar, onde passamos a maior parte do dia, onde tínhamos nos unido para nos protegermos de uma malícia desconhecida, estava todo manchado com sangue fresco, se transformando em um mar de sangue...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 今天我們大半時間都在這裡度過。我們為了對抗某人的惡意，保護自己，曾經聚集在這裡。然而現在，這裡卻完全被鮮血浸透，染成了一片血海…！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 今天我们大半时间都在这里度过。我们为了对抗某人的恶意，保护自己，曾经聚集在这里。然而现在，这里却完全被鲜血浸透，染成了一片血海…！！
Italian (IT): Quel luogo in cui avevamo trascorso l'intera giornata, dove ci eravamo radunati per metterci al riparo dal male perpetrato da un ignoto... era stato colorato di un rosso vivido, ed era diventato un lago di sangue...!!
Turkish (TR): Neredeyse bütün günümüzü geçirdiğimiz, bilinmeyen bir kötülükten korunmak için birbirimize kenetlendiğimiz bu yer, taze kanla kaplanmış, bir kan okyanusuna dönüşmüştü...!!

Umineko Project (UP): Aaaaaah, ......now even the eighth twilight is over. And the next one, the ninth twilight, ......what was it again...?

Umineko Project (UP): .........She was facing the far wall, ...standing stock still, completely alone.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Ela estava encarando a parede distante, ...ainda de pé, parada e completamente sozinha.

Turkish (TR): .........Uzak taraftaki duvara bakıyordu, ...kıpırdamadan öylece, tamamen tek başına duruyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Facing away from this horrible scene, standing in front of the wall, singing her song over and over...
Steam (ST): She faced away from this horrible scene, standing by the wall, singing her song over and over...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She faced away from this horrible scene, standing by the wall, singing her song over and over...
PC Japanese (JP): この惨状に背を向け、壁の前に立ち、ずっとずっと、歌を歌い続けていた…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Diante dessa cena horrível, de pé, em frente à parede, cantando repetidamente aquela canção...

Umineko Project (UP): We had come here trying to save Maria from some approaching danger.
Steam (ST): We had come here, trying to save Maria from some approaching danger.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E agora que nós encontramos ela, nós deveríamos estar correndo até ela, felizes por ela estar segura. ......E mesmo assim, nenhum de nós conseguia fazer isso...!

Turkish (TR): ...Şimdi onu bulduğumuza göre, yanına koşmalı, ona sarılmalı ve güvende olduğu için sevinmeliydik. ......Ama yine de hiçbirimiz bunu yapamadık...!

Umineko Project (UP): Everyone thought it. But they couldn't say it. After all, because...because...that's right, it's crazy, and yet......but no, it couldn't be.........!!

Umineko Project (UP): My body consumed by an anger I didn't know what to do with, I stole the rifle from Aunt Natsuhi's hand, and spun around, pointing the barrel of the gun into the darkness on all sides, as though I was pointing a light from a lighthouse, trying to find the culprit.
Steam (ST): My body was consumed with an anger I didn't know what to do with, and I snatched the rifle from Aunt Natsuhi's hand. I spun around, pointing the barrel of the gun into the darkness on all sides, as though I was pointing a light from a lighthouse, trying to find the culprit.

I spun around, pointing the barrel of the gun into the darkness on all sides, as though I was pointing a light from a lighthouse, trying to find the culprit.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はどこへぶつければいいのかもわからぬ怒りに身を焦がし、夏妃伯母さんの手よりライフル銃を奪って、全方位の暗闇に銃口をぐるぐると、まるで灯台のように向けては犯人の姿を探す。
Russian (RU): Меня всего охватил гнев, который я не знал куда деть, я взял ружьё из рук тёти Нацухи, развернулся, направляя дуло во тьму во все стороны, словно я был маяком, вращающим луч света, в поисках преступника.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Meu corpo foi consumido pela raiva e eu não sabia o que fazer, então eu tirei o rifle das mãos da tia Natsuhi, e me virei, apontando a arma para a escuridão que nos rodeava, como se eu estivesse apontando a luz de um farol, tentando encontrar o culpado.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我被无处倾泄的愤火点燃，从夏妃伯母的手中夺过了来复枪，旋转着枪口扫过四周黑暗，像灯塔似的搜寻着犯人的踪影。
Italian (IT): Non sapendo dove indirizzare la rabbia che mi stava consumando, presi il fucile dalle mani di zia Natsuhi, e rivolsi in ogni direzione la canna dell'arma verso l'oscurità, alla ricerca della figura del colpevole come se stessi puntando la luce di un faro.
Turkish (TR): Bedenim ne yapacağımı bilemediğim bir öfkeyle dolup taşarken, Natsuhi Teyze'nin elinden tüfeği aldım, ve etrafımda dönerek silahın namlusunu her taraftaki karanlığa doğrulttum, sanki bir deniz fenerinden ışık tutuyormuşum gibi, suçluyu bulmaya çalışıyordum.

Turkish (TR): Ve sevgiden mahrum geçirdiği onca gün de hiç yaşanmamış gibi.

Umineko Project (UP): Both hands were almost touching near the top.{n}......Very soon, it would be 12 a.m. ...In other words, 24:00.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Both needles were almost touching near the top.......Very soon, it will be 12:00 at night. ...In other words, 24:00.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ２本の針は頂点で交わろうとしている。{n}……もうじき、午後１２時を迎える。…つまり、２４時だ。

Umineko Project (UP): When you think about it, isn't 24:00 a strange time?{n}...It can be called 24:00, and it can also be called 0:00.
Steam (ST): When you think about it, isn't 24:00 is a strange time? ...It can be called 24:00, and it can also be called 0:00.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando você pensa nisso, 24:00 não é uma hora estranha?{n}...Pode ser chamado de 24:00, e também podemos chamar de 0:00.

Umineko Project (UP): It's the hour at the culmination of the previous day, ...and at the same time, it is hour zero as the next day begins.

Russian (RU): Они, должно быть, говорили нам, что настало 24:00.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele provavelmente estava dizendo para nós que já eram 24:00.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那應該，是通知二十四點的報時吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那应该，是通知二十四点的报时吧。
Italian (IT): Probabilmente stava comunicando lo scoccare della mezzanotte.
Turkish (TR): Muhtemelen bize saatin 24:00 olduğunu söylüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): It was both a tone telling us that we had reached the culmination of this day, and a tone informing us that all had returned to nothing.
Steam (ST): It was both a tone telling us that we had reached the culmination of this day, and a tone informing us that all had returned to nothing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was both a tone telling us that we had reached the culmination of this day, and a tone informing us that all had returned to nothing.
PC Japanese (JP): 今日という日の全てが満ちたことを知らせる音色にして、それが全て無に戻ったことを知らせる音色。
Russian (RU): Их тон говорил нам, что день достиг своей кульминации, и что всё вернулось к ничему.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era uma batida que nos dizia que havíamos chegado ao ponto culminante deste dia, e também nos informando que tudo retornaria ao nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是告知今天一天已經圓滿結束的音色，也是告知一切全都回歸虛無的音色。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是告知今天一天已经圆满结束的音色，也是告知一切全都回归虚无的音色。
Italian (IT): Era un suono che comunicava la conclusione di quell'intera giornata, e informava che ogni cosa era tornata ad essere nulla.
Turkish (TR): Bu hem günün zirvesine ulaştığımızı söyleyen bir sesti hem de her şeyin hiçliğe geri döndüğünü haber veren bir ses.

Umineko Project (UP): {i:The rules had specified that the witch would win when time ran out}.
Steam (ST): {i:The rule that the witch would win when time ran out had already been revealed}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The rule that the witch would win when time ran out had already been revealed.
PC Japanese (JP): {i:時間切れは、魔女の勝利となると、ルールは明記されていた。}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {i:時間切れは、魔女の勝利となると、ルールは明記されていた}。
Russian (RU): {i:Правило, что ведьма победит, когда время истечёт, уже было установлено}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {i:As regras especificavam que a bruxa venceria se o tempo acabasse}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {i:規則裡明示了，時間用盡，即是魔女的勝利。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {i:规则里明示了，时间用尽，即是魔女的胜利。}
Italian (IT): {i:Nelle regole era stato specificato che, a tempo scaduto, la vittoria sarebbe stata della strega.}
Turkish (TR): {i:Kurallara göre zaman dolduğunda cadı kazanacaktı.}

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Battler. ...George onii‐chan and Jessica onee‐chan. ......The journey...{0}has ended...{0}and the witch...{0}has revived...{0}you see?"
Steam (ST): "......Battler, ...George nii-chan and Jessica. ......The journey has ended, and the witch has...revived, see?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Battler. ...George nii-chan and Jessica. ......The journey has ended, and the witch has...revived, see?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………戦人。…譲治兄ちゃんに朱志香。……旅は、終わって、魔女は、蘇ったよ？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………戦人。…譲治兄ちゃんに朱志香お姉ちゃん。……旅は、終わって、魔女は、蘇ったよ？」
Russian (RU): ".........Баттлер...... Джордж нии‐чан и Джессика онээ‐чан. ......Путешествие... подошло к концу... и ведьма... воскресла... видите?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Battler. ...George onii‐chan, Jessica onee‐chan. ......A jornada...{0}chegou ao fim...{0}e a bruxa...{0}foi revivida...{0}não é mesmo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………戰人。…讓治哥哥還有朱志香姐姐。……旅途，結束了，魔女，復甦了喲？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………战人。…让治哥哥还有朱志香姐姐。……旅途，结束了，魔女，复苏了哟？」
Italian (IT): "...Battler... Cugino George, Jessica... Il viaggio si è concluso, e la strega è risorta, visto?"
Turkish (TR): ".........Battler. ...George onii-chan ve Jessica onee-chan. ......Yolculuk...{0}sona erdi...{0}ve cadı...{0}yeniden dirildi...{0}gördünüz mü?"

Umineko Project (UP): And {i:none shall be left alive.}
Steam (ST): And {i:none shall be left alive}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And none shall be left alive.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、{i:誰も生き残れはしない}。
Russian (RU): {i:И кто в живых остался — будет мёртв}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E {i:ninguém deve sobreviver.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，{i:無人生還}。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，{i:无人生还}。
Italian (IT): E {i:nessuno verrà lasciato in vita}.
Turkish (TR): Ve {i:hiçbiri hayatta kalmayacak.}

Umineko Project (UP): {e:070:The witch shall praise the wise, and bestow four treasures.{n}{n}One shall be all of the Golden Land's gold.{n}One resurrects all the dead people's souls.{n}One even revives all the love they possessed.{n}And one for the witch to eternally rest.{n}{n}Rest in peace, my beloved witch, {f:5:Beatrice}}.
Steam (ST): {e:070:The witch shall praise the wise and bestow four treasures. {n}{n}One shall be all the gold from the Golden Land. {n}One shall be the resurrection of all the dead souls. {n}One shall be the resurrection of the love that was lost. {n}One shall be to put the witch to sleep for all time. {n}{n}Sleep peacefully, my beloved witch, {f:5:Beatrice}...}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch will praise the wise, and should bestow four treasures. One shall be, all the gold from the Golden Land. One shall be, the resurrection of the souls of all the dead. One shall be, even the resurrection of the lost love. One shall be, to put the witch to sleep for all time. Sleep peacefully, my most beloved witch, Beatrice...
PC Japanese (JP): {e:070:魔女は賢者を讃え、四つの宝物を与えるだろう。{n}{n}一つは、黄金郷の全ての黄金。{n}一つは、全ての死者の魂を蘇らせ。{n}一つは、失った愛すらも蘇らせる。{n}一つは、魔女を永遠に眠りにつかせよう。{n}{n}安らかに眠れ、我が最愛の魔女ベアトリーチェ…。}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {e:070:魔女は賢者を讃え、四つの宝を与えるだろう。{n}{n}一つは、黄金郷の全ての黄金。{n}一つは、全ての死者の魂を蘇らせ。{n}一つは、失った愛すらも蘇らせる。{n}一つは、魔女を永遠に眠りにつかせよう。{n}{n}安らかに眠れ、我が最愛の魔女ベアトリーチェ。}
Russian (RU): {e:070:Похвалит ведьма мудрых и вручит им четыре дара:{n}{n}Первый — всё золото, что в Золотой Земле.{n}Второй — из праха мёртвых воскрешение.{n}Третий — возвращение утраченной любви.{n}Четвёртый — ведьме сном забыться вечным.{n}{n}Покойся с миром, моя возлюбленная ведьма {f:5:Беатриче}}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {e:070:A bruxa elogiará o sábio, e lhe concederá quatro tesouros.{n}{n}Um deve ser todo o ouro da Terra Dourada.{n}Um deve ser a ressurreição das almas de todos que foram mortos.{n}Um deve ser a ressurreição do amor perdido.{n}Um deve ser colocar a bruxa para dormir por toda a eternidade.{n}{n}Descanse em paz, minha amada bruxa, {f:5:Beatrice}}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {e:070:魔女定將讚頌賢者，授予四樣寶物。{n}{n}一是，黃金鄉之中的全部黃金。{n}一是，令所有死者的靈魂復甦。{n}一是，就連已逝的愛也會復甦。{n}一是，使魔女進入永遠的沉眠。{n}{n}安寧地睡吧，吾最愛的魔女貝阿朵莉切。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {e:070:魔女定将赞颂贤者，授予四样宝物。{n}{n}一是，黄金乡之中的全部黄金。{n}一是，令所有死者的灵魂复苏。{n}一是，就连已逝的爱也会复苏。{n}一是，使魔女进入永远的沉眠。{n}{n}安宁地睡吧，吾最爱的魔女贝阿朵莉切。}
Italian (IT): {e:070:La strega loderà la tua saggezza, e ti concederà quattro tesori.{n}{n}Uno sarà tutto l'oro della Terra Dorata.{n}Uno sarà la resurrezione di tutte le anime dei morti.{n}Uno sarà persino la resurrezione dell'amore andato perduto.{n}Uno sarà il conferire alla strega un eterno riposo.{n}Riposa in pace, {f:5:Beatrice}, mia amatissima strega}...
Turkish (TR): {e:070:Cadı bilgeleri övecek ve dört hazine bahşedecek.{n}{n}Biri Altın Diyar'ın bütün altınları olacak.{n}Biri tüm ölü ruhların dirilişi olacak.{n}Biri kaybedilmiş aşkın dirilişi olacak.{n}Ve birisi de cadıyı sonsuza dek uyutmak olacak.{n}{n}Huzur içinde uyu, sevgili cadım, {f:5:Beatrice}}.
